title: Data Analyst Lead - APAC GBM
job_description:
Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started.The same properties that make the Facebook platform an ideal place for marketing also make the platform an ideal place to conduct measurement. The Data Analyst Lead is charged with leveraging these capabilities on behalf of Global Business Marketing to measure and optimize marketing investments in the APAC region. We are seeking experienced analytics professional who can partner effectively with the business leadership on driving the measurement practice supporting the GBM team in the APAC region.You will work cross-functionally with several teams at Facebook (including marketing, operations, data engineering and data technology), with the objective of driving Global Business Marketings effective, analytically driven and strategic growth and innovation. In this role you will require a combination of exceptional analytical skills including hands on statistical modelling, background in data-driven decision-making and strong partner and communication skills. Your experience includes managing data pipelines and dashboards, ability to make recommendations based on imperfect data pulled from multiple sources (internal and external), strong business intuition to guide your analysis, and ability to work both independently and cross-functionally. You are intellectually curious, learn quickly, and move fast while maintaining focus on high-impact projects. This is a full-time position and is located in our Singapore office.

Responsibilities:
  • Partner with marketing, research, and product organizations to scope, design, execute, measure, and improve the impact of marketing efforts on the APAC business
  • Translate data insights into actions and decisions that will drive revenue, brand sentiment, user growth and engagement, and marketing effectiveness
  • Develop quantitative analysis, tools, ad hoc reports, and models to support marketing decision making. Analysis areas might include areas such as retention, sentiment, lifetime value, messaging, promotions, usage, and engagement
  • Design data visualization such as charts, infographic, and dashboards to communicate findings and actionable recommendations to internal stakeholders
  • Help create, maintain, and improve key data sets, pipelines and reporting to track and manage APAC GBM activities
  • Project manage improvements to measurement methodologies, products, and approaches in the APAC region

Mininum Qualifications:
  • BA/BS in Engineering, Statistics/Math, Economics or related field
  • 8+ years of work experience in consulting, measurement technology, research or analytics experience and experience-based aptitude to use data and numbers to formulate insights
  • 5+ years of experience manipulating data sets with packages such as R, Python, SPSS, SAS, R, MATLAB, Tableau
  • 4+ years of experience in SQL and/or other programming language
  • 3+ years experience with digital marketing optimization or product optimization work i.e. funnel/website optimization and/or outbound channels like SEO, SEM, and email
  • Experience leveraging data driven models to drive business decisions, using data access tools and building visualizations using large datasets and multiple data sources
  • Knowledge of statistics and optimization techniques. Hands-on experience with large datasets (i.e. data extraction, cleaning, modelling, interpretation and presentation)

Preferred Qualifications:
  • MBA or graduate degree in a quantitative field
  • Ability to manage multiple concurrent projects and drive initiatives in a cross-functional environment
  • Experience with Brand and Direct Response measurement solutions such as Brand Lift, Conversion Lift, Multi-Touch Attribution etc.
  • Experience or familiarity with CRM platforms (ex. Salesforce, Oracle CRM, SAP CRM)
  • Experience operating within globally distributed teams

title: AVP, Senior Data Analyst - Data Management and Analytics, GDMO
job_description:
As part of the data management & analytics team, the candidate fulfilling this role gets to drive the implementation of data standards and controls to enable the effective use of data within the Bank to better support its business and customers.

The successful candidate can expect to work with a dynamic team, and is expected to:
  • Perform regular review of critical data elements (CDEs), critical reports and taxonomies, through engagement with stakeholders from various functions within the Group, including senior management
  • Maintain data assets within the Group to facilitate consistent understanding of definitions for critical measures and CDEs, and their aggregation to ensure accurate, consistent and comprehensive representation of data for better risk and performance management
  • Independently lead project tasks as the Group embarks on further entrenching data standards and controls with other stakeholders, as part of the Group’s drive towards a data-driven organisation
  • Leverage on the data management tools within the Group, and championing its use through coaching of other users within the Group; on-the-job training of the tools will be provided
  • Assess the state of the data quality within the Group as means of identifying potential control gaps, present findings to senior management and be part of the data remediation effort
  • Be involved in enterprise-wide projects through the gathering and provision of user requirements, as well as execution of user acceptance testing (UAT) for changes to manage their impact on the data management tools and the accompanying database
Requirements:

  • Preferred 6-9 years of related working experience in the areas of data governance, data management and data quality, of which 4 years of working experience in a banking or financial consulting environment is a must.
  • General appreciation of data management and governance principles, with prior working experience in data analytics and/or MIS reporting role
  • Strong team player with good communication skills and able to work with multiple stakeholders including senior managers
  • Knowledgeable in RDBMS with ability to write complex SQL for data manipulation & extraction; additional experience in Python, R, etc will be viewed favorably
  • Strong problem-solving skills and an ability to prioritise and manage multiple tasks
  • Good knowledge in Microsoft EXCEL, Word and Powerpoint, and BI tools like Qlikview or Tableau

title: Data Analyst
job_description:
About Perx:
Perx Technologies provides a fully integrated solution that combines a next-generation SaaS loyalty management system and omni-channel marketing technologies to deliver revenue-driving digital customer experiences.

The Perx Loyalty and Customer Engagement platform allows large B2C enterprises to drive meaningful digital customer experiences targeted at millions of customers. The A.I. enabled platform is trusted by the likes of UOB, HSBC, Central group, AXA, Prudential, Digi, among others in the South East Asian and European markets to drive revenue.

We’re a company that understands that product innovation comes from people innovation, and that’s why we invest in cultivating leaders and HIPOs throughout the organization. If you’re passionate about creating and contributing to a top-notch culture and talent pool, join us!

Job Overview:
We are looking for a product-focused Data Analyst who can story-tell with data. The hire should have great knowledge in Google Analytics and data mining skills to turn data into information, information into insight and insights that can be transformed into BI features. The Data Analyst will have a deep appreciation and desire to understand loyalty engagement behaviours. He/She will work closely with our backend engineers, data engineers as well as business users on data initiatives. They must be self-directed and comfortable supporting the data needs of multiple teams, systems and products.

Essential Functions:
Drive the design and implementation of data metrics to derive insights on user behavior and campaign performance through reports, dashboard and third-party analytics platform.
Turn business requirements into data model and generate source to target data mappings and other technical documentation (data transformations, design and operational support documentation), in clearly written language
Identify data gaps and propose new data metrics that can value add to our Business Intelligence solution
Provide data analytics consulting services to internal stakeholders and clients, including data analytics planning and strategy – perform data analytics visioning and road-mapping, business case development, implementation planning, organisational planning, budget and risk management planning
Experience in data models, database design development and segmentation techniques is optional
Proven working experience as a data analyst or business data analyst
Work closely with stakeholders and cross-functional teams to understand their needs/ pain points, scope the problem and develop business case on how to turn data into critical information and knowledge that can be used for clients campaigns
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Work with data and analytics experts to strive for greater functionality in our data systems.

Expected Areas of Competence:
Experience in building reports and/or data visualization
Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports
Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets
Filter and “clean” data by reviewing computer reports, printouts, and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems
Locate and define new process improvement opportunities
Outstanding quantitative and analytical skills
Excellent verbal and written communication
Effective troubleshooting and problem solving skills
Strong team player who is customer oriented
Possesses the urgency and drive, with a great sense of ownership.

Education/ Experience Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree/Masters degree with Analytics background.
3+ years of experience developing end-to-end Business Intelligence solutions
Excellent skills in Google Analytics and other third party analytics tools.

Travel Requirements:
No.

title: Junior Data Analyst
job_description:
Corecam Investment Group – with offices in Singapore, Switzerland, Vietnam, Austria and Germany. We are an independent, partner-owned investment management group with a proven track record as an active investor in the liquid multi-asset class as well as exclusively sourced direct investments. To support our rapidly growing business, we are seeking a self-driven, highly motivated candidate to work directly with our portfolio management team.

These will be your tasks
  • Assist team with system integration (portfolio management system, data base, intranet...)

  • Perform performance calculation and performance contribution analysis

title: Infrastructure Data Analyst Intern
job_description:
Job Description

Our Company is an innovative, global healthcare leader that is committed to improving health and well-being around the world. Our product offering categories include oncology products, vaccines, infectious diseases and animal health. We continue to focus our research on conditions that affect millions of people around the world while expanding our strengths in areas like vaccines and biologics. We also devote extensive time and energy to increasing access to medicines and vaccines through far-reaching programs that donate and deliver our products to the people who need them.

The Global Infrastructure Operations (GIO) is the pillar to IT infrastructure of the company. The organization comprises of operations, engineering, portfolio and strategy teams supporting technology towers across servers, databases and storages, data center, and workplace services. The GIO Strategy team seeks a Data Analyst for the our IT Hub to enhance IT infrastructure reporting capability and data visualization. The targeted outcome will include driving positive changes and new ways of working in making decisions through data and metrics.

Description

Your role is to support the data analytics and reporting function in GIO.
You will conduct research, testing, data analysis, develop visualization for dashboards and reports, documentation and ensuring the data updates are made available on timely basis.
You will be working on data wrangling, data analysis and modelling after you have developed an understanding on infrastructure data. You will find patterns, problems, anomalies and simplify analysis through visualization of data onto dashboards for users to take action or make decisions.
You will work with various Infrastructure (servers, storage, and database etc) teams to understand their data collection methods, processes and gain insights into their data for integration and quality measurements. You will work with the team and understand their pain-points, and deliver recommendations for improvements.

In this role, besides data analytics, you will gain the domain knowledge of IT infrastructure.

Technical Skills:
Knowledge in Linux, SQL, Python, BI tool (eg Tableau, Spotfire)
Knowledge in IT infrastructure (Windows/Linux servers, Oracle database, SAN/NAS storage) will be an added advantage

Who we are

Merck & Co., Inc., Kenilworth, New Jersey, USA is known as “Merck” in the United States, Canada & Puerto Rico. We are known as “MSD” in Europe, Middle East, Africa, Latin America & Asia Pacific. We are a global biopharmaceutical leader with a diverse portfolio of prescription medicines, oncology, vaccines and animal health products.

We are driven by our purpose to develop and deliver innovative products that save and improve lives. With 69,000 employees operating in more than 140 countries, we offer state of the art laboratories, plants and offices that are designed to Inspire our employees as we learn, develop and grow in our careers. We are proud of our 125 years of service to humanity and continue to be one of the world’s biggest investors in Research & Development.

What we look for

In a world of rapid innovation, we seek brave Inventors who want to make an Impact in all aspects of our business, enabling breakthroughs that will affect generations to come. We encourage you to bring your disruptive thinking, collaborative spirit and diverse perspective to our organization. Together we will continue Inventing For Life, Impacting Lives while Inspiring Your Career Growth.

INVENT.

IMPACT.

INSPIRE.

We are proud to be a company that embraces the value of bringing diverse, talented, and committed people together. The fastest way to breakthrough innovation is when diverse ideas come together in an inclusive environment. We encourage our colleagues to respectfully challenge one another’s thinking and approach problems collectively for the common good. We are an equal opportunity employer, committed to fostering an inclusive and diverse workplace.

title: Risk Data Analyst
job_description:
This is Adyen

Speed is the foundation of our company. We think fast. We work fast. We launch fast. Our merchants’ demands shape our development path, and we never stop until the job is done. We’re creating our own path, with a global team driving sustainable growth. We don’t do hierarchy, egos or boundaries. “Not possible” is not in our vocabulary — “freedom” is. This is who we are: honest, direct and always bringing an element of fun into our work. If you’re ready to join the power of fast, keep reading.

Risk Data Analyst

Adyen’s Risk Team focuses on powering all of Adyen’s fraud prevention efforts. From providing risk solutions to merchants, to building out real time dashboards to detect anomalies and prevent payments fraud early, Adyen’s risk efforts are central to what we do.

We are looking for a passionate Risk Data Analyst who has experience working in teams that build merchant facing solutions and is hands on with data analytics.

What will you do:
  • Provide necessary data analysis to create business value for the merchants.
  • Use predictive analytics to solve complex problems and drive business decisions.
  • Write SQL to query relational databases.
  • Work cross functions with development and data analytics team across regions.
  • Communicate conclusions across different stakeholders and generating insights, also including client facing.
  • Work with data visualization tools to turn raw numbers into easy to understand and impactful graphs.
  • Work with Looker, Grafana or/and Python.
  • Manage the risk strategy of large merchants and report to their management.
Who you are:
  • DNA: High energy, dynamic, self-starter with a proven entrepreneurial drive. Passionate for data analytics. You like to work in a high-paced environment where quick shift of priorities is not an issue.
  • Analytical experience: You have experience working in data analytics, preferably in payments/financial risk/credit risk. You are highly skilled at writing SQL to query databases. You have experience with different data and statistical analysis techniques.
  • Other experience: You understand machine learning algorithms and anomaly detection. You are able to visualize data and communicate conclusions to non-technical stakeholders. Looker, Grafana and/or Python experience is a plus.
  • Knowledge: You understand global payments ecosystem, as well as payments fraud, risk, trust & safety.
  • Ownership: You are committed and you have demonstrated an ability to maintain high levels of productivity with minimal supervision.
  • English business level – additional language is a plus.
Who we are

Adyen is the payments platform of choice for many of the world’s leading companies, providing a modern end-to-end infrastructure connecting directly to Visa, Mastercard, and consumers' globally preferred payment methods. Adyen delivers frictionless payments across online, mobile, and in-store channels. With offices across the world, Adyen serves customers including Facebook, Uber, Spotify, Casper, Bonobos and L'Oreal.

Ready to meet us?

If you are excited about this role, apply by clicking the below link. We can’t wait to meet you!

title: Data Analyst
job_description:
About Klook

Founded in 2014, Klook provides a seamless way for travelers to explore the popular attractions, tours, local transportation, food and beverage, and unique experiences around the world on Klook's website and award-winning app (consecutive Best of Year awarded by Google Play and Apple App Store). Each day, Klook's travelers indulge in their wanderlust and spontaneity through over 100,000 offerings in more than 350 destinations. With a team of more than 1,500 across over 20 offices worldwide, Klook's services are available in 10 languages, supporting 41 currencies.

What you'll do
    • Partner with non-technical stakeholders (product team) to understand their analytical needs, help confirm data metrics and build data frame by asking the right questions, document and prioritize requirements
    • Design, write and support extract, transform, and load (ETL) processes of user tracking data (e.g. customer lifecycle, segmentation and migration), deliver insightful data findings for business success
    • Interpret results using a variety of techniques, ranging from simple data aggregation via statistical analysis to complex data mining
    • Support gathering of additional data for ad-hoc analysis as needed
    • Recommend different ways to constantly improve data reliability, efficiency, and quality
What you'll need
    • BS/MS or higher degree in mathematics, computer science or other technical/quantitative discipline
    • Proficient with database management and analytic tools and languages supporting data analysis and reporting - SQL, Python, R, and Excel
    • Experience with Google Analytics / Appsflyer / Mixpanel is a plus
    • Experience with BI tools such as Tableau
    • Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including the ability to communicate complex data findings in a structured and clear manner to a non-technical audience
    • Self-starter and entrepreneurial spirit with hands-on approach towards business
Why Klook?

At Klook, we are passionate for all things travel. We strive to bring the world closer together by connecting travelers with the best of any destination. To get us there, we are fueled by a truly global and diverse workforce that is revolutionizing the travel industry.

We celebrate uniqueness, curiosity, ambition, grit and integrity. We are excited to take ownership and are fearless in pursuing success. We believe in the strength of the collective and the spirit to constantly try new things, learn from failures and adapt fast to improve. These are the qualities that bind us together as one cohesive family.

The World is Yours to Explore. We make this a reality by empowering travelers to discover, book and experience the best things to do anywhere, anytime. Be a part of our journey and make an impact with us.

Unleash your potential, explore new and untapped opportunities, achieve greater heights and join the team that is building the future of travel.

Sounds like just the place for you? Then, what are you waiting for?

job_description:
Data Analyst (Product)

  • Singapore

ABOUT US

Build the Smarter Way to Shop!

ShopBack is a rapidly growing digital loyalty and discovery platform, with a clear mission to create a world of Smarter Shoppers. We are a passionate team that wants to drive innovation and build a product that we love and are all proud of!

At ShopBack, our engineering teams build scalable platforms and utilize leading-edge technologies to build a world-class product. You will join a diverse and talented team of aspiring engineers with great ambitions to impact the eCommerce landscape. We are seeking team members who strive to solve the hard problems, take pride in delivering world-class products and are strong team players.

Responsibilities

Your role as a Product Analyst will see you applying your expertise in Quantitative Analysis, Data Mining and Data Visualization to troubleshoot issues and craft creative solutions together with our data team to provide our shoppers with the best user experience.

At Shopback, we are BIG on employee engagement and strive to provide the best environment for you to thrive in. Your knowledge and skills will be heavily relied upon to improve our products and services and provide a fresh perspective on how we work. For highly motivated individuals such as yourself, you will be responsible for...
  • Ownership of product usage, engagement metrics, and designing of reports and dashboards.
  • Working closely with product owners to evaluate, influence and execute new features/future feature models.
  • Having a deep understanding of product direction and user analytics across all products to discover insights, guide decision making and identify areas for product growth.
  • Working closely with product owners to design and evaluate A/B tests and experiments. Your input will be critical to the improvement of product quality and will aid us in scaling our operations.
  • Building a strong understanding of ShopBack’s data ecosystems within the internal teams as a role model/strategist whilst advocating a self-service analytics culture which focuses on the efficient and effective use of data.

Requirements
  • 3+ years hands-on experience in product analytics roles, with experience in end-to-end services, which includes data gathering, analysis and scalable deliverables, preferably in a fast-moving environment with large, complex and high velocity data.
  • Experience with data analysis leveraging SQL

  • Excellent communication skills to convey about issues with both technical and non-technical audiences.
  • Experience in big data technologies (Pyspark, Presto) and cloud solutions (AWS) is a plus.

Key areas of responsibility:

Master data management

Own and develop the core source of truth Analytical Database for Wego. Constantly improve on data structures and analytical DB design as business needs and product evolves. Make as much information from data available as possible to allow the company to drive decisions with data.

Work with stakeholders upstream of data team such as product and data engineering to define data structures and schema. Work with stakeholders downstream of data team to understand analytical and business reporting needs. Hands-on data debugging, development and deployment skills would be required.

Data Analytics and Modelling

Applies appropriate analytical techniques to generate information from master data to support decision-making for various stakeholders. Run data-driven project that would put our data to good use. These can be in various forms such as visualization reports, scheduled tasks and scripts, aggregated tables etc.

Develop predictive modelling and trend analysis from data to support higher-level, strategic decision-making and reporting. Apply statistical and predictive techniques onto our master data for deeper insights.

Technical skills:
  • Experience maintaining scripts and processes to generate analytical datasets.
  • Ability to work in advanced Python and SQL to manipulate and transform data.
  • Ability to run and deploy tasks using deployment tools such as Git / Jenkins / Airflow.
  • Experience working with major Big Data technologies such Bigquery (internal tool), Redshift, Hadoop / Spark etc.
  • Knowledge of cloud platforms such as Google Cloud Platform (internal tool), Microsoft Azure, Amazon Web Services (AWS).
  • Experience working with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Qlik, Chartio etc.
  • Knowledge of other languages such as R, Ruby / Javascript would be a plus.
  • Knowledge of advanced statistical predictive models would be a plus.
Requirements:
  • Solid experience developing and working with relational and analytical data structures.
  • Comfortable working within large, complex databases and data warehouse.
  • Demonstrates sound knowledge of data processing concepts- transforming raw data into processed, ready to use analytical datasets.
  • Experience working on and optimizing data pipelines, ETLs or ELTs.
  • Good track record of leading and growing a team of data analysts to fulfill data requirements.

title: Data Analyst (Special Projects) / Data Engineer
job_description:
About us

We pride ourselves as the best and largest vertically integrated, omni-channel women’s fashion brand in the region. Founded in 2010, we’ve grown to 200 people strong, proudly headquartered in Singapore with country offices in Indonesia, Malaysia, and Hong Kong and an omni-channel presence across these 4 markets. In addition to our retail franchise in Cambodia, we ship internationally to 14 markets (China, Philippines and Australia, New Zealand, US, Canada, Macau, Japan, Korea, Vietnam, Thailand, Myanmar, Cambodia & Brunei).

We are taking our definition of new female retail global, with our sights set on becoming the most thoughtful brand for the everyday woman.

The team

The Love, Bonito team is a passionate, dynamic, innovative and fun-loving family. From fashion-lovers, savvy marketers to tech whizzes, we have a diverse team of talented individuals with one unified focus - our customer, the Love, Bonito woman. She is at the heart of everything we do and we pride ourselves in always taking an innovative, data-centric yet considerate approach in creating the right experiences, products and content for her. With big dreams and a grand mission, we’re looking for great like-minded people to join us - people who are as passionate, fearless and entrepreneurial.

If you’re looking for a dynamic, no corporate-BS environment to learn, grow, and really make an impact, we could be the perfect fit for you!

Data Analyst: The role

You’ll have front seat experience in impacting women across the globe through fashion and data.

You’ll have the opportunity to deep-dive into key strategic projects and work across both online and offline data points to come up with actionable insights and wins for us to improve our omni-channel experience. You will play a pivotal role in championing a data-driven approach in our decision-making.

Main responsibilities
  • Develop a deep understanding of our customers and operations through data to help us make better business decisions and drive our growth and strategy
  • Define key performance metrics, build reports and perform analysis alongside business leads to efficiently monitor business health and uncover valuable insights to improve our operations
  • Evaluate, design and implement analytics solutions that provide actionable insights and decision guidance / automation
  • Mine large amounts of inventory, transactional, and clickstream data to find ways to improve our assortment, launch schedule and inventory planning process
  • Develop statistical models to improve our decision making process and quantify commercial impact (e.g. analyse and forecast our sales and customer behaviour in the context of our launches and marketing initiatives)
  • Collaborate with stakeholders to design and develop A/B tests to test hypotheses
  • Support the development of our data infrastructure and develop a strong understanding of our data warehouse to improve the quality and scope of insights that it enables
You should have / be
  • A Love, Bonito Culture Fit
  • Good grasp of the Love, Bonito brand and unique proposition
  • A genuine curiosity to know how things work and how to make them better
  • An entrepreneurial, self starter, get-your-hands dirty attitude
  • Enjoy learning new things and pick them up quickly
  • A demonstrated past and present data obsession
  • Ability to understand and solve loosely defined problems and come up with relevant answers and actionable insights to guide product development decisions
  • A deep understanding of numbers, as well as a strong business sense
  • A knack for problem solving with an ability to think ‘out of the box’ and translating data into simple human language (data storytelling), to empower the broader organization to understand and leverage data
  • A high attention to detail
  • Strong project management skills
  • Good relationship management and ability to work
Data Engineer: The Role

You’ll have a front seat experience in impacting women across the globe through fashion and data. As a data engineer in our data team, you will play a pivotal role in championing a data-driven approach in our decision-making, building trust in our data and ensuring that our analytics workflow is robust and empowered by high quality data.

You should have / be
  • Good grasp of the Love, Bonito brand and unique proposition
  • A genuine curiosity to know how things work and how to make them better
  • A self starter with a strong work ethic and ‘get things done’ attitude
  • Enjoy learning new things and pick them up quickly
  • Humility and self confidence with the fact that you will be a subject matter expert who will be building the underlying data infrastructure
  • Focus and a high attention to detail, especially in understanding the intricacies of source systems, the meaning of the data flows (and thus the underlying business processes) so to design and build robust and optimized pipelines
  • Strong project management skills especially with long-term data warehousing projects
  • Strong relationship management and influencing abilities; ability to build strong relationships and trust with internal and external stakeholders and influence upstream SOPs
  • Strong project management skills and ability to manage and influence other functional peers
Main responsibilities
  • Design, build, improve and maintain our data infrastructure to power and optimize our analytics workflow and data platforms
  • Take key ownership of our data warehouse and ensure pipelines are reliable and efficient today, and plan ahead for our future
  • Always finding ways to evaluate and measure the quality and health of current pipelines and infrastructure (e.g. the consistency, accuracy, and relevancy of data in our data warehouse)
  • Integrate various (new) data sources (e.g. from our e-commerce, offline POS, third-party data) into structured datasets so that the business can extract maximum value from data. Your work in ensuring high quality data is accessible sets the foundation for quality in our reports, reliability of predictive models and overall quality of data-driven insights
  • Anticipate, identify, investigate and solve issues that will improve the quality, accuracy and robustness of our data
  • Develop a deep understanding of our analytics workflow and business goals so to ensure we are always leveraging the right tools and so that data is properly understood, transformed and aligned with our business goals
  • Support implementation of new projects, initiatives and roll-out of new systems so that relevant data is captured, transformed and stored in an efficient way
  • Design and develop new tools that will improve our current workflows
  • Work closely with data analysts to productionize models and bring our data insights & analytics to the next level
  • Share your expertise, learnings best practices and ideas with the broader team so that we raise our standards & improve as a team.
Requirements

Data Analyst (Special Projects): Qualifications & Experience
  • Graduated with a second upper class or equivalent
  • A degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Operations Research, Econometrics or related field
  • 2- 5 years experience in an Analytics role
  • Highly proficient in SQL and programming experience in Python for analytics contexts
  • Experienced in using BI visualization tools (Tableau / Metabase)
  • Experienced in using statistics and algorithmic methods to solve business problems and visualizations to communicate insights
  • Experience in Google Analytics, or from an e-commerce background would be meritable
  • Experience in Data warehouse development, especially AWS Redshift, will be advantageous.
  • Good communication and organization skills
  • You enjoy working with data and all its faults, benefits and opportunities
Data Engineer: Qualifications & Experience
  • A degree in Computer Science or a related technical field
  • At least 1-2 years of relevant experience
  • Good understanding about database systems like MySQL, MSSQL and PostgreSQL
  • Highly proficient in SQL and Python programming
  • Experience in data modeling, data warehouse development and data tools development
  • Experience with workflow automation tools such as airflow
  • Experience in AWS cloud infrastructure will be a big plus
  • Good background in statistics would be a plus
  • Experience with E-commerce, GTM and google analytics would be a plus
  • Familiarity with big data framework (e.g. Hadoop, Spark) would be a plus
  • Experience with data analysis and BI visualization tools would be a plus
  • Good communication and organization skills
  • You enjoy working with data and all its faults, benefits and opportunities
Benefits
  • Full corporate insurance
  • Flexi benefits
  • Staff discounts
  • A dynamic, no corporate-BS environment to learn, grow, and really make an impact

title: Data System Analyst
job_description:
A leading organisation is seeking analytics professionals to work as Data System Analysts to be part of a large-scale digital transformation project implementation in Singapore.

Mandatory Skill(s)

Degree in Computer Science, Applied Mathematics or equivalent;
Has 3 years of relevant working experience in Data Analytics platform;
Experienced in administrating and managing databases such as SQL, Oracle, Mongodb, PostgreSQL;
Must have participated in implementing ETL (Extract-Transform-Load) software such as Informatica, Talend, IBM Cognos, Tibco, SAS;
Ability to analyse large sets of data generated from multiple sources while ensuring data integrity;
Posses good knowledge in programming technologies such as Python, Java, Scala, SPSS, C#;
Experienced in data modelling and query tuning on SQL server or similar platforms;
Experienced in preparing reports and dashboards development using Qlikview, PowerBI, Tableau, MicroStrategy or other business intelligence tools;
Skilled in statistical tools such as R, SPSS, Matlab;
Has a strong aptitude for numbers and comfortable handling large volumes of data;
Strong analytical, problem solving, and communication skills.
Desirable Skill(s)

Data certifications;
Responsibilities

Responsible for creating and maintaining optimal data architecture;
Design and develop ETL (Extract-Transform-Load) scripts and procedures to derive data from various sources, perform data migrations across different systems, databases and server;
Gather and process raw data from data sources such as offline files by writing scripts, web scraping, calling API’s and writing SQL queries;
Develop data set processes for data modelling, mining, production and process unstructured data into suitable forms for analysis purpose;
Build and implement scripts for database maintenance, monitoring and conduct performance tuning;
Develop reports, dashboards and visualizations using multiple data sources in Power BI, Tableau or QlikView;
Analyze databases to recommend improvements and optimization measures;
Perform testing and validation to verify data accuracy and prepare progress reports regarding business database status and health;
Analyze complex data elements, systems, data flow, dependencies and relationships in order to contribute in building logical data models;
Perform adhoc data analysis, write SQL scripts, stored procedures.

title: Data Analyst, Unskippable Labs
job_description:
Minimum qualifications:
  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • Experience in SQL, building dashboards, and automating analyses.
  • Experience with creative measurement tools (e.g., MMM, Nielsen NetEffect, Nielsen Catalina, Ipsos Connect, etc.)
  • Experience leading and working in cross-functional environments, across countries and cultures.
Preferred qualifications:
  • 5 years of experience in analytics and media measurement, testing creative and/or media strategies.
  • Experience in Media Measurement methodologies and testing solutions from external vendors. Experience in high productivity environments.
  • Ability to make strategic recommendations for video strategies and effectively managing multiple projects and stakeholders. Ability to present data in compelling simple ways, build dashboards, and automate on-going analyses and reporting.
  • Ability to effectively extract creative learnings. Excellent analytical, data visualization, and written and verbal presentation and communication skills.
  • Experience presenting to senior-level client. Experience in spreadsheet and presentation software. Understanding of digital landscape for brand marketers.

About the job



Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing business grow. Using your influencing and relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.

Google’s Unskippable Labs identifies and activates opportunities for brands to make their ads work better. We use machine-learning, global experimentation, and meta-analysis of top campaigns to identify what makes ads most effective in order to share those best practices. We address complex brand video challenges and deliver unique insights, creative analyses, and audience targeting solutions to help brands maximize ad effectiveness.

As a Data Analyst, you will work closely with the Advertising Intelligence team to build and deliver data-driven solutions, deliver Ad Effectiveness reports, custom analyses, and diagnostic tools. You will learn about new data sets and make data accessible for the team through dashboards to present internally and externally. Additionally, you will demonstrate excellent business judgment and the ability to build structured processes and methodologies from scratch. You will comfortably navigate other global/regional teams who are working on creative/media effectiveness to unlock new opportunities and share learnings.

Our Global Clients & Agency Solutions team helps serve some of the world's largest brands. Our dedicated teams of marketing and advertising specialists use their unique skill sets to help shape how companies grow their businesses in the digital age. We aspire to advise our clients on all aspects of their online business strategy. Using Google's broad range of products, we help our clients connect instantly and seamlessly with their audiences.

Responsibilities

  • Design new measurement methodologies/solutions to test creative experiments by leveraging Google and/or third-party solutions.
  • Analyze results from creative effectiveness research, combined with additional Google data, to provide insights and inform clients creative and media strategies and executions.
  • Extract data to develop creative effectiveness meta-learnings across critical industry verticals.
  • Ensure all client/team research deliverables are completed on time. Support the team in managing direct client relationships and help them use Google insights to drive their business.
  • Lead efforts to hack/combine Google's measurement tools to develop sharper creative effectiveness methodologies that provide deeper insights.

At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.

title: Data Analyst
job_description:
Viki is a premier global entertainment streaming site where millions of people discover and consume primetime shows and movies subtitled in more than 200 languages, by our community of fans. With billions of videos viewed and more than 1 billion words translated, Viki brings global entertainment to fans everywhere! We are also part of the Rakuten Group of companies, which includes Viber, eBates, Lyft and more, reaching a global audience of nearly 1 billion users.

Soompi, also part of Rakuten Viki, is one of the biggest global K-pop news sites and the longest-running fandom community. From innovative engagement features to original content and social shopping, Rakuten Viki and Soompi are pushing the boundaries of user engagement and social viewing.

At Rakuten Viki, our engineering teams utilize leading-edge technologies to build a world class product. You will join a diverse and talented team with great ambitions to change the digital entertainment landscape. We are looking for top talent across APAC to join our Growth Analytics team as a Data Analyst. If you are inspired to take up new challenges then come be a part of our Rakuten Viki team in Singapore.

Viki is seeking a smart and hard-working Data Analyst for our Product and Growth Analytics Team. At Viki, we handle terabytes of data to help us understand our users and learn about content trends. Our analytics team is first and foremost responsible for collecting, processing and organizing these large amounts of data using advanced and scalable techniques. They then analyze these complex datasets to generate deeper insights and help various teams at Viki effectively utilize it for crucial decision making.

Responsibilities:
  • Create useful reports and dashboards to help generate insights for Product and Growth teams.
  • Help structure and analyze A/B tests and data from experiments
  • Validate events data and work with engineers to ensure that data collection has been correctly implemented
  • Conduct inferential analysis and predictive analysis to model user behavior and relevant metrics
  • Analyze content consumption data to help content and marketing teams strategize
  • Deep dive into big data and provide business intelligence and analytics support to key company-wide business initiatives
Qualifications:
  • BS in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics or a related discipline with 2-4 years of relevant work experience
  • Outstanding quantitative and analytical skills
  • Highly proficient in writing complex SQL queries
  • Deep understanding of the usage and interpretation of statistical methods
  • Interest in large scale data mining, gathering insights and reporting
  • Prior experience with the following languages/tools is highly preferred:
    • For data modeling: R, Python
    • For data processing: Hadoop, MapReduce, Kafka, BigQuery, Spark
    • For data visualization: Tableau, Qlikview, Looker, Holistics


We're small but diverse, with more than 25 nationalities and 40 languages represented among our 100+ employees. Come break down barriers that stand between great entertainment and its fans everywhere and help us make a difference as we grow.

title: Data Analyst/R programmer (6-month)
job_description:
Introduction

At the Economist Intelligence Unit’s Healthcare Division (EIU HC), we believe that actionable strategy for our client is built on the basis of market realities, where data insights and its robust analytics drive informed decisions. For that reason, we have developed a data-centric market tracker solutions called, The Gateway that aims to provide the medtech sector with credible, actionable and granular size, share and growth insights globally.

To this end, we are looking to fill a Data Analyst/R programmer–on contractual basis. This position exists to assist the team in making strategic data-related decisions by analyzing, manipulating, tracking, internally managing and reporting data. This position functions both as an analyst and as a R programmer.

This role will be based in Singapore. It will be a 6-month contract for a start.

Accountabilities

How you will contribute:
Design and enhance databases
Develop reports with accurate, easy to read useful information
Design and generate tracking and monitoring tool
Develop the model end-to-end on R platform in consultation with the project team
Write and maintain the necessary R scripts
Develop the rule engine for import of data and export of output/results in desired format
Test and review the codes to meet quality standards
Train the project team extensively in R programming – with a focus on the tasks needed for this specific model
Experience, skills and professional attributes

The ideal skills for the role are:
Demonstrable and extensive experience in R programming
Experience in handling large datasets in R
Prior experience in developing models or modelling techniques using R, preferably in a commercial environment but relevant academic use case can also be useful
Multiple solutions delivered to completion across the full project life cycle: inception of project brief, analysis, design, implementation, testing, and the ongoing running of the solution on a long-term basis
Experience in developing a multi-user application, exposure towards session management and database architecture built around R-programming.
Strong project delivery track record
Proficient communication and presentation skills in English
Ability to interact with multidisciplinary teams through the product development life cycle
Extreme proficiency in setting up, optimizing, testing, and debugging applications to ensure operation, quality and conformance to creative and engineering specifications

title: L&D Data Analyst, Learning Futures Group
job_description:
Who We Are

We aim to be at the forefront of innovation, charting the path to meaningful learning experiences in support of a future-ready Public Service. You will be joining a collaborative team that supports CSC’s ongoing efforts to innovate and incubate new learning methods for impactful learning experiences in the Public Service.

We work with internal and external partners to identify future learning trends and develop prototypes and pilots for potential application in CSC. This supports the organisation’s efforts to scale impactful learning innovation across the Singapore Public Service.

Who We Are Looking For

You know how to turn data into information and insights that drive decisions across an organisation. You will embed data collection and feedback mechanisms throughout our learning solutions to generate data-driven, actionable insights into the learning within the Public Service.

You are curious about the stories that data can tell, and imaginative in communicating these stories in a simple, yet compelling manner that connects to the organisation’s strategy and goals. You are driven to build and execute learning analytics capabilities in CSC.

You work closely and creatively in a fast-paced, agile environment with stakeholders, from researching and applying data-driven approaches to anchoring data strategy (systems, technological solutions and processes); and making recommendations that are clearly linked to CSC’s strategy and priorities.

You are an intrapreneur, both practical and imaginative in problem-solving especially in emerging situations. You take full ownership of the entire data process from project scoping and management, data integration, data exploration and analysis to data visualisation. You are also methodical and have a healthy dose of scepticism of the value and limits of data.

title: Instrument and Pricing Reference Data Analyst
job_description:
JPMorgan Chase
& Co. (NYSE: JPM) is a leading global financial services firm with assets
of $2 trillion and operations in more than 60 countries. The firm is a leader
in investment banking, financial services for consumers, small business and
commercial banking, financial transaction processing, asset management, and
private equity.

Business
Overview

Global
Reference Data Operations (GRDO) is one of the top priorities across the Chief
Administrative Office. Our team will help the company evolve to a more
integrated data management strategy, which is globally consistent and
usable for business, finance, risk and regulatory requirements. Our processes
and systems associated with the production and consumption of reference data
are managed by a number of areas, in a variety of ways. As such,
the Firm wide Data Management Executive Committee has agreed to establish a
centralized technology and operations team that will be responsible for
managing enterprise reference data, including the Financial, Instrument,
Product, Pricing, Client and Common reference data our businesses and corporate
groups rely on for reporting and other purposes.

The Asset
Pricing & Reference Data (APRD) utility, a major component of GRDO with
over 400 staff globally, services all areas of J.P. Morgan Chase Corporate
& Investment Bank, Asset Management, Consumer & Community Banking and
the Commercial Bank. APRD provides high quality Pricing &
Reference Data to its subscribers from major external market providers such as
Bloomberg, S&P, Thomson Reuters under a single operating model. Data
is sourced, validated, mastered and distributed via J.P. Morgans strategic
Pricing & Reference Data architecture and is used for trading, risk
management, settlement and regulatory reporting.

Position
Summary

INSTRUMENT
REFERENCE DATA OPERATIONS are responsible for creating, maintaining and
investigating reference data across the firms strategic instrument reference
data platform and various legacy applications acting as guardians of that data
and responding to request and queries from the users.

Roles &
Responsibilities
  • Create new instruments for Equity
    Derivatives products in Reference Data system
  • Update/modify assets based on
    internal client initiated changes (Middle Office, Trade support,
    Settlements) or Corporate actions. Regular maintenance of securities that
    require coupon, rate fixing and/or factor updates on a daily basis from
    sources like Bloomberg, Reuters etc.
  • Perform research through Bloomberg
    and Reuters to find missing or additional information required to complete
    set up or maintenance.
  • Participate/Coordinate in special
    projects such as; data clean up, process improvement analysis, metrics
    reporting
  • Plan and prioritize all projects
    handled by the team.
  • Monitor rejects Queue and clears
    them on a timely basis. Ensuring Checklist, Metrics and EOD activities are
    completed and signed off.
  • Ensuring timely updating/review of
    SOPs, Issue Logs and Project tracker.
  • Handling and monitoring issue and
    query mails and escalating issues promptly to the Team Leader
  • A proactive approach to problem
    solving, taking ownership of issues and having the determination to follow
    things through
  • Flexible work approach be willing
    to operate within a shift environment (Potential early and late shift
    starts)
  • Availability to work a share of
    Singapore Public Holidays. Time off in lieu will be provided for public
    holidays worked.
  • Relationship Management
Qualifications:
  • College Degree with 2-4 Years of experience in Exchange Traded Derivatives.
  • Knowledge of external reference data providers BLOOMBERG, REUTERS, etc. will be an advantage
  • Knowledge of handling various related instrument reference data, Middle office functions - desirable
  • Proficient in MS excel
  • Excellent communication skills both oral and written
  • Ability to multitask effectively
  • Flexible and willing to stretch
  • Focus on quality and controlled environment
  • Attention to detail.

title: Data Analyst
job_description:
Requisition Number: SG-16543
Area of Interest: Information Technology
Organization: Corporate
Brand/Division: Combined Services Singapore
Position Type: Full-time

JOB DESCRIPTION

JOB PURPOSE:

We are looking for a passionate and quick-thinking individual. This successful candidate will transform raw data into meaningful and insightful information, that empowers our business users for better decision making.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:
  • Interpret data, analyze results using data collection techniques and provide ongoing reports
  • Gather data information from various sources and interpret patterns and trends to make it digestible for stakeholders
  • Produce accurate and insightful reports detailing the health, content and insights available from the data for strategic planning and review on performance metrics
  • Compose and prepare complex presentation materials or perform metrics analysis for Senior Management
  • Develop and implement data collection techniques where needed, data analytics and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality
  • Locate and define new process improvement opportunities
REQUIREMENTS AND QUALIFICATIONS

JOB HOLDER'S COMPETENCIES & EXPERIENCE:
  • Degree/Diploma Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics, Mathematics
  • Proven 2-3 years of working experience as a data analyst.
  • Strong in data crunching and analysis and are comfortable dealing with numerical data
  • Excellent command of excel and access, SQL queries and database management structure
  • Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
  • Adept at queries, report writing and presenting findings
  • Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques
  • This is a 1-year contract role.
Williams-Sonoma, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

title: Senior Data Analyst
job_description:
The Retail Data Analyst will lead and perform complex analysis in an evolving data environment. In addition to very strong technical skills, this position requires superb business process analysis and interpersonal skills. The ability to extract and analyze shopper behaviour related data (footfall, demographic, crowd density, shelves engagement and sales transaction data), patterns, and related trends is needed, with the subsequent ability to synthesize the data into information consumable by different department from marketing, senior business decision-makers, operation team and leasing department.

Retail business analyst job entails conducting quantitative and qualitative analyses including customer behaviour, retail trends, etc. The role involves presenting the shopper Analytics insights and educating the usage of the data to clients.

Responsibilities:
  • Complete projects that require Data Mining, Analysis, and Presentation.
  • Focus on Solutions, Dive into Projects, quickly identify Drivers in Data.
  • Identify relevant Trends, conduct follow-up Analysis & prepare Visualizations.
  • Develop Dashboards to track remediation of issues.
  • While the focus of this role is the extraction and interpretation of data, it also requires the capacity to identify, explore, interpret and present key trends, ideas and concepts.
Requirements:
  • A Bachelor’s degree in Math, Computer Science, Business Analytics, or a related field is required. Candidates with a Masters’ degree will be preferred.
  • 5-8 years’ Working Experience with tools like Power BI (essential), Qlikview, Tableau, Hadoop and Excel.
  • Proficiency in SQL.
  • Effective Communication and Project Management skills are important.
  • The ideal candidates should have experience working in a business/data analysis role in the retail business processes and retail systems experience.
  • Strong Mathematical & Statistical Skills.
  • Self-starter – must be productive with minimal direction.
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced, technical, cross-functional environment.
  • Excellent visual design sense regarding clear and accurate presentation of data.
Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $4,500.00 to $6,000.00 /month

Experience:
  • Data Analytics: 5 years (Preferred)
Location:
  • Singapore (Required)

title: Data & Integration Analyst
job_description:
The Data & Integration Analyst position will support the business by helping the customer to understand, integrate and use our content in ways that best supports their workflow and needs.

They will also play a key role in supporting the expansion of our content into new capabilities and systems. They will play a key role in supporting the product management and account management teams in support of key business development and account management activities.

Responsibilities:
  • Undertake scheduled/regular product support tasks
  • Ad Hoc Provision of sample data, especially configuring larger sets of data for defined scenarios
  • Support with use case creation and refinement for demonstration and case studies and integrator support
  • Support customers and systems integrators with generation, supply and refinement of custom sample sets of content
  • Creation and maintenance of representative/current sample data sets for use by sales colleagues in demonstration purposes
  • Support the development of enhanced offline capabilities including content access and enhanced browse capabilities
  • As content and delivery evolves, support the transition for new customers
  • Become a key stakeholder in informing development teams of enhancement and modifications to optimize delivery systems
  • Support the customer to understand and extract the most value from our content and data capabilities
  • Supports the development of project plans for new tools, development resources, capabilities, etc.
  • Provide feedback to the business on data, tools, technologies and workflow support required by the customer, to inform the development pipeline
  • Create and send sample data sets to customers; provide advisory support to customers on data attributes and ingestion
  • Creation of instructional documentation, and FAQ documentation
  • Respond to customer enquiries; support sales / customer care training on new functionality
  • Become a specialist in IHS Janes offline content and its provision
Skills/Requirements:
  • Essential - Excellent data transformation experience
  • Essential - Excellent problem-solving abilities
  • Desirable - Data science techniques NLP, Python, SQL a distinct advantage
  • Desirable - Data Modelling Experience
  • Desirable - Demonstrable technical understanding via work experience, IT/ Development related qualifications, or Degree
  • Desirable - Demonstrate good aerospace and defense subject knowledge

title: Data Analyst
job_description:
At Lalamove, we believe in the power of community. Millions of drivers and customers use our technology every day to connect with one another and move things that matter. Delivery is what we do best and we ensure it is always fast and simple. Since 2013, we have tackled the logistics industry
head on to find the most innovative solutions for the world’s delivery needs.
We are full steam ahead to make Lalamove synonymous with delivery and on a mission to impact as many local communities we can. We have massively scaled our efforts across Asia and now have our sights on taking our best in-class technology to the rest of the world. And we need your help to get us
there!
Currently, we are building a strong in-house Regional marketing team here in Hong Kong & looking for a strong data analyst with a passion for Marketing to further strengthen our Growth Analytics team within our Growth Marketing organization. You will be responsible for carrying out analysis of internal CRM
data, analysing customer surveys & building reporting workflows to drive insights for our growth leaders as well as to our marketing managers to support decision making and further profitable growth.
What you'll do
The Day-to-day activities Understand and measure all stages of customer and driver acquisition funnel from awareness to purchase
Integrate, cleanse, migrate and manage data. Help develop the creation, flow and analysis of key data
Uncover actionable insights about our business through complex data analysis and communicate those insights effectively to functional leaders
Automate and maintain weekly, monthly and quarterly performance report to provide key learning and feedback (trends, patterns, irregularity) for the Regional Country Operations Team
Develop, execute, and report on growth experiments to provide insights to conversion rate optimization
What you'll need
3+ years professional experience in a quantitative field at a mobile or consumer web company
BA/BS in Business, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering or similar is preferable
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to draw inferences from abstract data patterns
Familiarity with data visualisation application (Tableau and/or other Business Intelligence tools)
Experience working with relational databases and SQL, Python.
Experience with developing, implementing, and reporting on AB tests.
Good understanding of key marketing metrics such as CAC and LTV
Desire to work in a fast-paced environment and to drive decisions with data
Excellent written and communication skills

title: Data Analyst Lead - Brand Analytics
job_description:
Job Description:

  • Develop and design reports / dashboards for our brand partners

  • Must be proficient in SQL
  • Familiar with Python and data visualization tools
  • Experience in brand analysis preferred
  • Experience in Hadoop ecosystem (Hadoop, Spark, Hive) preferred

title: Business Analyst (Data Analytics)
job_description:
Your primary focus will be to use data to help the government design solutions that address its policy and business problems, and stay close to the needs of the general public. You will be responsible for demonstrating how better use of data can help recommend new policies, streamline operations or bring more customised solutions for citizens. You should have some training and working experiences on data analytics, and should be comfortable with hands-on data manipulation, data modelling and data visualisation.
What to Expect:
  • Provide data analytics consulting services to the government agencies, including data analytics planning and strategy – perform data analytics visioning and road-mapping, business case development, implementation planning, organisational planning, budget and risk management planning
  • Work closely with stakeholders to understand their needs/ pain points, scope the problem and develop business case on how to turn data into critical information and knowledge that can be used for policy making, streamlining operations or developing solutions for citizens.
  • Advise stakeholders on the key ICT trends and best practices in data analytics, assess applicability for adoption and recommend solution that best fits stakeholders’ needs
  • Perform data cleaning, pre-processing and feature engineering that facilitate meaningful analysis
  • Work closely with data scientists to mine insights from structured and unstructured data and to resolve complex statistical modelling problems to answer pertinent business questions.
  • Design dashboards and interactive visualisation as tools for data exploration as well as for storytelling. Present analytics insights to business users and stakeholders
  • Work with stakeholders to ensure smooth deployment and adoption of new solution

How to Succeed:
  • Degree/Master in Computer Science, Electronics Engineering, or related IT disciplines
  • Minimum 3 years of relevant working experience
  • Ability to take a broad, strategic perspective as well as drill deep to understand business needs and challenges
  • Understand key concepts, techniques and considerations in Machine learning and Data analytics
  • Advanced or Expert in visual analytics technologies such as Tableau.
  • Experience or training in one or more of the following areas:
  • Statistical modelling tools such as: R, Python, RapidMiner, Knime, SAS, Matlab or SPSS
  • Data manipulation using scripting languages like Python or using ETL tools
  • End-to-end analytics architecture, preferably with some working knowledge of big data stack
  • Excellent communications skills, both oral and written, with ability to pitch ideas and influence stakeholders
  • Strong analytical, conceptualisation and problem solving skills
  • Team player with strong organisation and people handling skills
  • Passion for the use of analytics and data to improve public service

title: Data Analyst
job_description:
As a Data Analyst, your role is to understand the needs of the business and use data to derive a solution that you will then present, implement, and track. In addition to having a knack for problem-solving, it is absolutely crucial that you are willing to learn, understand, and hear the needs of our people. In a small team, you will be working regionally on various products.

We solve challenging problems, but not for nothing. At Funding Societies, we pride ourselves on focusing on impact. The work you do will help raise visibility in the business and enable data-driven decision making. As a team, we are excited about translating findings into actionable insights, seeing that drive change in our organisation and ultimately bringing value to our customers.

If you enjoy seeing your work drives impact and appreciate a fun working environment, this is the place for you.

What will you be doing?

Ingesting, processing, visualising and analysing data

Discovering and communicating actionable and accurate insights

Creating dashboards for performance measures and operational visibility

Partnering with business teams to develop key metrics for success measures

Own and manage project deliveries

Building and maintaining data models

What do we really want?

1-5 years of working experience in Data Analytics or other relevant fields

Strong logical reasoning, analytical mind and highly structured in thinking

Independent learner who enjoys technical challenges, working with numbers, and problem solving

Highly skilled in SQL

Good communication skills

Growth mindset, eager learner and open to receiving feedback

What do we think is good to have?

Experience working with BI tools such as Tableau, MicroStrategy, Periscope or Sisense

Educational background in quantitative fields (e.g. Mathematics / Computer Science)

Project management experience

Domain exposure to financial services

Experience working with GitHub

Collaborative and embodies teamwork

title: BUSINESS DATA ANALYST
job_description:
Key Responsibilities:
Understand and document data needs of sales, marketing and other departments
Assist business in making process decisions by providing relevant data
Facilitate decisions about technical data solutions, including serving as an expert or advisor on which solutions are appropriate for which business needs.
Serve as an expert on the data management and reporting capabilities
Work with IT and business community to build consensus on designs
Escalate issues affecting scope, budget, and timelines
Consistently interact professionally and work productively with employees at all levels
Document business and technical requirements for reports
Document business and technical requirements for business-facing reporting platforms
Document data mappings and technical requirements for data exchanges between systems
Create dataflow diagrams
Training the business on self-service reporting solutions
Delivering reports and datasets from various systems
Managing data migration into and out of various systems
Suggest metrics and analyze data when appropriate
Perform data profiling
Work closely with BI and market intelligence departments
Work closely with on-line business team
Requirements

Required Experience, Skills and Education:
Bachelor’s degree preferred
Advanced analytical thinking and problem-solving skills
“Get it done” attitude
Strong planning and organizational skills
Ability to ramp up quickly in any functional area
Ability to work successfully on cross-functional teams
Minimum 2 years of experience in an analysis or consulting position
Strong data reporting skills
Strong knowledge/advanced user of Microsoft Excel. Visual Basic knowledge a plus
Knowledge of SQL, and reporting solutions for integrations with CRM systems
Experience in data modeling
Experience creating data flow diagrams (DFD)
Demonstrated ability to manage relationships with both internal and external customers
Demonstrated ability to work independently and within a collaborative team-oriented environment using sound judgment in decision-making
Proficient in MS Office suite (Word, PowerPoint, Visio) software
Experience with Master Data Management is a plus
Experience with call centers, sales, or marketing is a plus
Experience with data dictionaries and/or other types of metadata repositories is a plus
Experience gathering functional requirements for applications and reporting is desired
Experience with enterprise reporting tools is a plus

title: Asset & Wealth Management - Chief Data Office, Client and Account Project Manager/Business Analyst APAC - Vice President
job_description:
JP Morgan Chase & Co. (NYSE: JPM) is a leading global
financial services firm with assets of $2.3 trillion and operations in more
than 60 countries. We serve millions of U.S. consumers and many of the world's
most prominent corporate, institutional and government clients. We are a leader
in investment banking, financial services for consumers, small business and
commercial banking, financial transaction processing, asset management and
private equity. J.P. Morgan is a global leader in asset and wealth management
services. With assets under supervision of $2.0 trillion and assets under
management of $1.4 trillion, we are one of the largest asset and wealth
managers in the world.

Overview

A critical priority for Asset & Wealth Management (WM)
is to ensure that high-quality data is available to run our business and meet
our clients' needs. The Asset and Wealth Management Chief Data Office
(CDO) was established to define AWM's data strategy and support for the core
data used across AWM and needed to run our business. The AWM CDO is positioned
in the AWM Operations division, reporting to the AWM Chief Operational Officer
(COO). We work with the AWM Business & Technology teams as well as the
Firmwide CDO team to deliver robust platforms and effective operating models to
ensure sound management of our data.

The AWM
Project Manager/Data Analyst will be
part of the Party & Account workstream which is focused on establishing
a global data strategy for client and account data - including simplified data
architecture, adequate data governance & controls as well as data health
metrics. The focus of the role will be on leading data
related projects and solving for data quality issues for Wealth Management in
the Asia Pacific region. The Project Manager/Data Analyst will work in close
partnership with Operations, Client Service, Business and technology teams in
Asia to ensure region specifics are adequately represented in the broader
strategic global data agenda. The Project Manager/Data Analyst will also
oversee the creation, modification, implementation of cl ient & account data
elements in the Systems of Record, including collaborating with the data owners
in designing the operating model and downstream systems/applications for the
adoption of the golden source.

Key Responsibilities
  • Act
    as key representative in APAC for WM Party & Account CDO team
    • Participate
      in various global data forums, initiatives and projects as the WM APAC
      CDO Party & Account lead
    • Provide
      transparency to APAC teams into broader Party & Account CDO agenda
    • Relay
      back to other regions and teams specific APAC considerations
    • Act as point of escalation for WM APAC teams
      as it relates to Party & Account data issues & requests
  • Develop deep understanding of client &
    account data in APAC, as well as associated End to End business processes; act
    as SME for Client & Account data in APAC
  • Drive the global roadmap from APAC
    perspective i.e. drive the adoption of golden sources, lead data and platform
    migrations where required, implement data standards (i.e. data quality controls,
    rules, data quality framework and Data Content Ownership)
  • Lead and deliver on APAC specific data
    enhancements and projects (e.g. new data elements), effectively managing scope,
    priorities, issues and resourcing requirements; laying out project plans,
    tasks, ownership; tracking and reporting on progress; Collaborate
    with the data owners in designing the operating model as well as with
    downstream systems/applications for consumption of golden source data
  • Manage WM APAC client & account data
    quality issues Partnering with Business, Ops and Tech teams on identifying
    and pipelining issues, prioritizing, conducting root cause analysis and planning
    for remediation activities
  • Develop key data quality metrics, KPIs and reporting
  • Develop key partnerships with a broad range of constituents and stakeholders across functions in APAC ; Prepare materials for stakeholder consumption and senior audiences (progress, issues, risks decision points); Chair WM APAC CDO specific forums
Qualifications
  • 5-10 years in Financial Services or Consulting in complex program and Stakeholder management
  • Deep knowledge of client data and related data privacy rules
  • Excellent project management, business/data analysis skills
  • Experience with operating model design and process reengineering End to End
  • Ability to work effectively and build strong relationships with teams across all levels of the organization
  • Ability to dive into details and synthetize information for executive communication
  • Independent, organized, self-motivated and a team player
  • Excellent verbal and written communication and presentation skills
  • Strong interpersonal leadership, partnership and influencing skills
  • Strategic thinker with the ability to quickly define and deconstruct problems leveraging strong analytical and end-to-end problem solving skills
  • Ability to prioritize and handle multiple tasks effectively; be proactive in a fast-paced environment
  • Possesses excellent judgment, knows when to escalate complex issues to senior management or functional partners with relevant expertise
  • Knowledge and understanding of Asset and Wealth Management business preferred
  • Advanced skills with the core MS Office suite (Excel, Word, and PowerPoint);
  • Advanced skills with standard PM tools (e.g. MS Project); Familiarity with process-mapping tools (e.g. MS Visio, etc.)

title: Data Analyst (HR)
job_description:
Job Description:
  • Design, develop and implement operational metrics and analytics for HR
  • Generate reports and dashboards that can enable HR to look at several aspects of employee behaviors such as attrition, turnover, tenure, performance, engagement, etc
  • Identify themes, trends and issues to generate useful insights and more data-driven decision making for HR
  • Enhance data collection procedures to include information that is relevant for building analytic systems

  • You may also have the opportunity to work on other projects in HR such as employer branding, employee engagement, performance management
