To all recruitment agencies: Great Eastern does not accept unsolicited agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our email or our employees. We will not be responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

title: Data Analyst (Part-time Internship)
company: ViSenze - Artificial Intelligence for the Visual Web
job_description:
Join us for a challenging paid internship that offers personal and professional development, networking opportunities and community-building.

As a Data Analyst intern, you will work closely with the Product Team and R&D Team, and be part of a larger team that builds large-scale data sets for our machine learning models.

You will:
  • Be responsible for understanding fundamental data requirements from Algorithm Engineers, building training dataset for the computer vision models with the expertise in assessing the quality and content of the imagery.
  • Be responsible for understanding critical acceptance criteria and test data requirements from Product Managers, building test & reference sets. Own the creation, update, and version management of standard test & reference sets.
  • Source for data through relevant websites/ databases and maintain an effective data sourcing process.
  • Develop and maintain good quality scripts to crawl the HTML/XML-based tasks on regular basis.
* Please note that you would need to have the right to work in Singapore before applying i.e You should be a Singapore Citizen, Permanent Resident, Student Pass or Dependent Pass Holder.

Requirements
  • Be at least in a Bachelor degree programme in Computer Science, Data Science, Analytics, Statistics, or any other quantitative-related areas.
  • Computer science fundamentals in data structures, data crawling
  • Programming experience with Python (Pandas, BeautifulSoup is plus), regular expression
  • Be comfortable with fast-paced working environments, changes, uncertainty and challenges
  • Result oriented, proactive attitude, self-motivated, team player
Benefits

We’re looking for people to join our cause – to simplify the visual web with really smart but simple visual tools. A technology startup spun off from the National University of Singapore (NUS) and backed by some of the most reputable international investors including Rakuten, we offer a rare opportunity to join a thriving, fast-paced, multi-cultural environment and be part of a truly exciting journey. You will be at the forefront of innovation, joining the only Artificial Intelligence startup in Singapore that tackles a global market.

About ViSenze

ViSenze is an Artificial Intelligence (AI) startup established in 2012 that develops advanced visual search and image recognition solutions to help businesses in eCommerce and content publishing. Using R&D in machine learning and computer vision technology, ViSenze enables shoppers to find or discover new products based on visual search, automatic photo tagging and recommendations based on their browsing history. ViSenze’s product verticals include the likes of Fashion, Home Decor amongst others.

ViSenze customers are well-known eCommerce and retail businesses around the world, like Rakuten, Urban Outfitters, Zalora, Interpark and many more. The company has raised $20 million in its Series C round of funding in early 2019 bringing its total investment to date to over $34 million.

title: Data Analyst
job_description:
About The Company


Creadits has reinvented digital advertising.


The world's largest advertisers are already on our platform:

  • World's largest ride-hailing apps
  • World's largest e-commerce marketplaces
  • World's largest gaming companies
  • World's leading apparel companies


A single global marketplace for advertising talent, using a unified currency - Creadits.


Creadits are used globally to acquire anything required to start advertising - graphic design, video shoots, writing, campaign management, training, even data.


The Creadits platform will provide a global view of talents and opportunities to get involved in projects.


A global talent pool can set values for Creadits, trading transparently.


Global talent will no longer be trapped by borders or exchange rates. Creadits unlocks and unifies advertising, across any platform, and any geography.


More than facilitating transactions, the Creadits platform can make creative and strategic recommendations, improving and predicting campaign outcomes.


Are you someone who can solve challenging problems? You dont just know how to code, more importantly, you know how to tackle problems innovatively. Programming language is merely a tool for you, making an impact is your real goal.


Creadits uses data-driven and AI-centric approaches to disrupt the way advertising used to be done. We are not an advertising agency. Instead, we help advertisers remove their reliance on agencies and achieve greater performance while spending less time on managing campaigns.


We are a team of people with diverse skill sets including deep learning, software engineering, computer vision, DevOps, statistics, and data engineering, and analytics. With core R&D of the company being the team's main responsibility, we do not limit your job scope, or, your potential. The only limit you may have is yourself.


Roles & Responsibilities

  • Work with product team in collecting requirements, create data pipelines. Focusing on improving the product features and providing insights to stakeholders.
  • Identify, collect, analyze, and interpret new data sets based on business requirements and generate descriptive visualizations and presentations to communicate insights, as needed.
  • Research new algorithms and machine learning solutions for solving business problems and improving the user experience.
  • Locate and define new process improvement opportunities.




Requirements:

Skills & Experience

  • Masters/Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Statistics, or other quantitative or related technical fields.
  • 2-5+ years of relevant experience in data analytics, data science or applied statistics.
  • Experience with machine learning, data mining, statistical modeling tools and underlying algorithms.
  • Strong experience in R, Python, and/or other languages for large scale analysis of data.
  • Strong knowledge of relational databases and SQL.
  • Experience with data visualization tools like Data Studio, Tableau, etc.


Nice to have

  • Experience in RESTful API design and implementation (Preferably in Python)
  • Knowledge of various machine learning libraries like Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, MLib etc. is a good plus.

Why work with us?

  • Build customer-facing technology products for global customers.
  • Chance to work with an international team of smart engineers.
  • Company-sponsored happy hours.


** Please upload your resume along with your application.

  • Strong knowledge of relational databases and SQL, logical and physical database design

  • Ability to work with big data and highly scalable programming experience
  • Experience with Linux and AWS
  • Experience with experiment design, A/B testing, and multivariate tests
  • Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyse, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
  • Strong application testing, integration, and implementation experience.
  • Ability to learn quickly and effectively apply new knowledge, demonstrating the desire to stay in touch with emerging technologies
  • Strong creative thinking and problem-solving skills
  • Proven ability to work in a fast-paced environment and to meet changing deadlines/priorities in simultaneous projects
  • Excellent organisational, communication and interpersonal skills; enjoy working in both individual and team settings
  • Demonstrated passion for data analysis
  • Experience with data visualisation tools (Tableau) is a good plus
APPLY NOW

Collaborative and embodies teamwork

title: L&D Data Analyst, Learning Futures Group
job_description:
Who We Are

We aim to be at the forefront of innovation, charting the path to meaningful learning experiences in support of a future-ready Public Service. You will be joining a collaborative team that supports CSC’s ongoing efforts to innovate and incubate new learning methods for impactful learning experiences in the Public Service.

We work with internal and external partners to identify future learning trends and develop prototypes and pilots for potential application in CSC. This supports the organisation’s efforts to scale impactful learning innovation across the Singapore Public Service.

Who We Are Looking For

You know how to turn data into information and insights that drive decisions across an organisation. You will embed data collection and feedback mechanisms throughout our learning solutions to generate data-driven, actionable insights into the learning within the Public Service.

You are curious about the stories that data can tell, and imaginative in communicating these stories in a simple, yet compelling manner that connects to the organisation’s strategy and goals. You are driven to build and execute learning analytics capabilities in CSC.

You work closely and creatively in a fast-paced, agile environment with stakeholders, from researching and applying data-driven approaches to anchoring data strategy (systems, technological solutions and processes); and making recommendations that are clearly linked to CSC’s strategy and priorities.

You are an intrapreneur, both practical and imaginative in problem-solving especially in emerging situations. You take full ownership of the entire data process from project scoping and management, data integration, data exploration and analysis to data visualisation. You are also methodical and have a healthy dose of scepticism of the value and limits of data.

title: Data System Analyst
job_description:
The Offer

Join a market leader within the Financial Services Industry.
Work alongside & learn from best in class talent.
Opportunity within a company with a solid track record of performance.

The Employer

Our Client is a leading multinational banking organisation, headquartered in Singapore. They have a global network of more than 450 branches and offices located at Asia Pacific, Europe and North America.

The company's core business is commercial and corporate banking services, personal financial services, private banking and asset management services, as well as corporate finance, venture capital, investment, and insurance services.

The Job

This role requires you to work with key stakeholders and business users to understand needs and requirements as well as manage vendor relationship and deliverables. You will seek to contribute and drive continuous process improvement initiatives to meet business needs. You will also oversee the Hadoop cluster from development that is in line with current and future needs, to providing expertise of the Hadoop ecosystem.

You will be responsible for:
Developing scripts to process structured and unstructured data.
Understand stakeholders’ needs with respect to data structure, availability, scalability and accessibility.
Making decisions with supporting reports.
Processing & Interpreting data to get actionable insights.
Establishing project plans, resources, budgets and time-frames, and assigning tasks.
Gathering, analysing, defining and formalising business requirements and processes into project/system specifications.
Identifying, tracking and communicating progress, milestones, deliverables, risks and issues.
Preparing project feasibility studies, cost-benefit analysis and proposals and obtain required approvals from IT management and project sponsors.
Extracting, transforming, loading and integration of data from various sources.
Monitoring the Hadoop cluster for performance and capacity planning, providing expertise and implementing real-time analytics use-cases on the Hadoop ecosystem.
Providing expertise on the various components & features of the Hadoop ecosystem.
Identifying trends, doing follow-up analysis, preparing visualizations.
Implementing real-time analytics use-cases on the Hadoop ecosystem.

The Profile

You have a degree in Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, Engineering or related field.
You have at least 8 years of experience, ideally within a Business Analyst- Data Sciences, Data Analyst or Data Engineer role.
You have experience within Big Data, Data Design, BI Reporting & Tools, Data Visualisation Tools (Tableau, QlikView, Hue etc.), Hadoop Ecosystem (Hadoop, Spark, Map/Reduce, YARN, Hive, Pig, Impala/Drill etc.) and Extraction, Transformation & Load (ETL) would be a strong advantage.
You demonstrate strong experience working with large and complex data sets as well as experience analyzing volumes of data.
You have strong interpersonal and communication skills and are adept at working with multiple stakeholders to drive desired outcomes.
You have good presentation and communication skills with the ability to present your findings clearly and accessible in reports and presentations to senior colleagues.
You are highly goal-driven and work well in a fast-paced environment.

title: Instrument and Pricing Reference Data Analyst
job_description:
JPMorgan Chase
& Co. (NYSE: JPM) is a leading global financial services firm with assets
of $2 trillion and operations in more than 60 countries. The firm is a leader
in investment banking, financial services for consumers, small business and
commercial banking, financial transaction processing, asset management, and
private equity.

Business
Overview

Global
Reference Data Operations (GRDO) is one of the top priorities across the Chief
Administrative Office. Our team will help the company evolve to a more
integrated data management strategy, which is globally consistent and
usable for business, finance, risk and regulatory requirements. Our processes
and systems associated with the production and consumption of reference data
are managed by a number of areas, in a variety of ways. As such,
the Firm wide Data Management Executive Committee has agreed to establish a
centralized technology and operations team that will be responsible for
managing enterprise reference data, including the Financial, Instrument,
Product, Pricing, Client and Common reference data our businesses and corporate
groups rely on for reporting and other purposes.

The Asset
Pricing & Reference Data (APRD) utility, a major component of GRDO with
over 400 staff globally, services all areas of J.P. Morgan Chase – Corporate
& Investment Bank, Asset Management, Consumer & Community Banking and
the Commercial Bank. APRD provides high quality Pricing &
Reference Data to its subscribers from major external market providers such as
Bloomberg, S&P, Thomson Reuters under a single operating model. Data
is sourced, validated, mastered and distributed via J.P. Morgan’s strategic
Pricing & Reference Data architecture and is used for trading, risk
management, settlement and regulatory reporting.

Position
Summary

INSTRUMENT
REFERENCE DATA OPERATIONS – are responsible for creating, maintaining and
investigating reference data across the firm’s strategic instrument reference
data platform and various legacy applications acting as guardians of that data
and responding to request and queries from the users.

Roles &
Responsibilities
  • Create new instruments for Equity
    Derivatives products in Reference Data system
  • Update/modify assets based on
    internal client initiated changes (Middle Office, Trade support,
    Settlements) or Corporate actions. Regular maintenance of securities that
    require coupon, rate fixing and/or factor updates on a daily basis from
    sources like Bloomberg, Reuters etc.
  • Perform research through Bloomberg
    and Reuters to find missing or additional information required to complete
    set up or maintenance.
  • Participate/Coordinate in special
    projects such as; data clean up, process improvement analysis, metrics
    reporting
  • Plan and prioritize all projects
    handled by the team.
  • Monitor rejects Queue and clears
    them on a timely basis. Ensuring Checklist, Metrics and EOD activities are
    completed and signed off.
  • Ensuring timely updating/review of
    SOPs, Issue Logs and Project tracker.
  • Handling and monitoring issue and
    query mails and escalating issues promptly to the Team Leader
  • A proactive approach to problem
    solving, taking ownership of issues and having the determination to follow
    things through
  • Flexible work approach – be willing
    to operate within a shift environment (Potential early and late shift
    starts)
  • Availability to work a share of
    Singapore Public Holidays. Time off in lieu will be provided for public
    holidays worked.
  • Relationship Management
Qualifications:
  • College Degree with 2-4 Years of experience in Exchange Traded Derivatives.
  • Knowledge of external reference data providers –BLOOMBERG, REUTERS, etc. will be an advantage
  • Knowledge of handling various related instrument reference data, Middle office functions - desirable
  • Proficient in MS excel
  • Excellent communication skills both oral and written
  • Ability to multitask effectively
  • Flexible and willing to stretch
  • Focus on quality and controlled environment
  • Attention to detail.

title: Data Quality Analyst
job_description:
Our Financial Information business in Singapore is seeking a Data Quality Analyst reporting to the Head of Data Operations APAC. The role is based in Singapore. The role is responsible for supporting and executing all the data quality improvement initiatives for the Asia Pacific region. The role sits within the wider Data Operations team in APAC contributing to the publishing of accurate, consistent and timely financial data which SIX is known for around the world.
  • To manage and support the data quality improvement activities and initiatives for all APAC markets.
  • Conduct daily quality checks and audits to measure the quality (accuracy, timeliness and completeness) of both reference and market data.
  • Report, analyze and present results of audits, checks and evaluations.
  • Identify and escalate areas for improvement to data quality issues.
  • Undertake root cause analysis on complex client data issues to identify main issue and solutions.
  • Leading team discussions related to Global Data Rules (GDRs) and Market Guides (MG) as well as accessing the impact of these on the APAC markets.
  • Review APAC specific working procedures and input processes according to GDRs and local MGs, identifying knowledge gaps and providing comprehensive training to Data Production staff within APAC.
  • Active involvement and contribution in global monthly quality calls, global data quality dashboard findings, virtual team discussions, APAC data quality audits, third party data supplier quality reviews and data quality clean-ups.
  • Collaboration with various functional areas namely:
    (a) Business Analysis on the impact of new content and feed changes on data quality,
    (b) Customer Support on client related complex data quality issues and
    (c) Marketing Products & Partners on the roll-out of new APAC content
The sucessful candidate will have excellent verbal and written business communications skills and hold an undergraduate degree in any discipline. He or she will be of an analytical and conceptual mind and have a broad knowledge of a range of asset classes as well as an understanding of the value chain of financial information. Previous experience and track record as a data trouble shooter or as an experienced data analyst is desirable.

He or she will be fluent in handling multiple tasks in parallel whilst retaining an overall view of the process (value chain), possess an excellent end-to-end data flow knowledge and have the technical IT ability to understand internal databases and ITIL processes. Customer focussed, he or she will be a self starter who can work independently yet be equally comfortable working within a team. Fluency in Asian languages are an advantage.

title: Data Visualisation Analyst
company: Cambridge Centre for Advanced Research and Education in Singapore Ltd
job_description:
Who are we looking for?

We are looking for a talented and creative Data Visualisation Analyst to support the J-Park Simulator (JPS) Project for data visualisation. The candidate should be specialised in creating a stunning interactive feature with the various sources of data and models.

The JPS project aims at a comprehensive virtualisation of industrial operations, i.e. a hierarchical representation of data and models associated with every entity in an industrial park, in order to exploit synergies for resource, energy, and emissions savings. The overall goal is, using ideas from the Semantic Web, Internet of Things, Industry 4.0, machine learning, artificial intelligence, and statistics, to create an integrated simulation platform and expert system capable of providing quantitative decision support.

The successful candidate will be expected to:
  • Develop our main software tool (JPS). This will involve keeping abreast of the latest web technologies, making key design decisions, and ensuring their realisation
  • Support the development of analytics solutions by conceptualising, designing, developing, documenting and maintaining high-impact visuals that express insights or complex scenarios in intuitive ways
  • Collaborate with team to understand needs for actionable insights
  • Architect efficient 2D and 3D User Interface system
  • Build a data model of entities which makes use of a geographical information system (GIS)
  • Designing and developing executable programs and browser-based applications
  • Identify, evaluate new technologies and resolve performance and scalability issues
  • Communicate complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders
  • Participate in research discussions with local industries and partners, overseas universities, and writing reports
  • Write conference/journal papers and reports
What skills will you need?
  • A good degree in Computer Science, Information Technology and Computer Engineering
  • Knowledge of tools such as Unity, Unreal, object-oriented programming languages (Java), scripting languages (Python), IDEs (NetBeans, Eclipse), Protégé, TBC and Chrome developer tools
  • Experience in UX design, CSS, WebGL, shader programming, NodeJS, gaming industry/software engineering/web development using C++/Java, as well as JavaScript/PHP, etc
  • Some understanding of relational and non-relational database management systems, semantic web and ontologies, HTTP protocol, APIs and data exchange formats such as XHL and JSON (an advantage)
  • Mathematical and statistical skills, with experience in algorithm and methods development (an advantage)
  • The ability to publish conference/journal papers
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills to work as part of a dynamic, multidisciplinary team of researchers
Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $4,000.00 to $6,000.00 /month

Experience:
  • Programming: 3 years (Required)
  • Web Development: 3 years (Required)
  • Scripting Languages: 3 years (Required)
  • UX Design: 3 years (Required)
Education:
  • Professional Qualification (Required)
Location:
  • Singapore (Required)
Language:
  • English (Required)

title: Data Analyst Lead - APAC GBM
job_description:
Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started.The same properties that make the Facebook platform an ideal place for marketing also make the platform an ideal place to conduct measurement. The Data Analyst Lead is charged with leveraging these capabilities on behalf of Global Business Marketing to measure and optimize marketing investments in the APAC region. We are seeking experienced analytics professional who can partner effectively with the business leadership on driving the measurement practice supporting the GBM team in the APAC region.You will work cross-functionally with several teams at Facebook (including marketing, operations, data engineering and data technology), with the objective of driving Global Business Marketings effective, analytically driven and strategic growth and innovation. In this role you will require a combination of exceptional analytical skills including hands on statistical modelling, background in data-driven decision-making and strong partner and communication skills. Your experience includes managing data pipelines and dashboards, ability to make recommendations based on imperfect data pulled from multiple sources (internal and external), strong business intuition to guide your analysis, and ability to work both independently and cross-functionally. You are intellectually curious, learn quickly, and move fast while maintaining focus on high-impact projects. This is a full-time position and is located in our Singapore office.

Responsibilities:
  • Partner with marketing, research, and product organizations to scope, design, execute, measure, and improve the impact of marketing efforts on the APAC business
  • Translate data insights into actions and decisions that will drive revenue, brand sentiment, user growth and engagement, and marketing effectiveness
  • Develop quantitative analysis, tools, ad hoc reports, and models to support marketing decision making. Analysis areas might include areas such as retention, sentiment, lifetime value, messaging, promotions, usage, and engagement
  • Design data visualization such as charts, infographic, and dashboards to communicate findings and actionable recommendations to internal stakeholders
  • Help create, maintain, and improve key data sets, pipelines and reporting to track and manage APAC GBM activities
  • Project manage improvements to measurement methodologies, products, and approaches in the APAC region

Mininum Qualifications:
  • BA/BS in Engineering, Statistics/Math, Economics or related field
  • 8+ years of work experience in consulting, measurement technology, research or analytics experience and experience-based aptitude to use data and numbers to formulate insights
  • 5+ years of experience manipulating data sets with packages such as R, Python, SPSS, SAS, R, MATLAB, Tableau
  • 4+ years of experience in SQL and/or other programming language
  • 3+ years experience with digital marketing optimization or product optimization work i.e. funnel/website optimization and/or outbound channels like SEO, SEM, and email
  • Experience leveraging data driven models to drive business decisions, using data access tools and building visualizations using large datasets and multiple data sources
  • Knowledge of statistics and optimization techniques. Hands-on experience with large datasets (i.e. data extraction, cleaning, modelling, interpretation and presentation)

Preferred Qualifications:
  • MBA or graduate degree in a quantitative field
  • Ability to manage multiple concurrent projects and drive initiatives in a cross-functional environment
  • Experience with Brand and Direct Response measurement solutions such as Brand Lift, Conversion Lift, Multi-Touch Attribution etc.
  • Experience or familiarity with CRM platforms (ex. Salesforce, Oracle CRM, SAP CRM)
  • Experience operating within globally distributed teams

title: D&L Intern Data Analyst
job_description:
Job Description

Join us in our mission to INVENT the future. Lets be part of our team of dedicated, energetic individuals who are committed to being the most trusted supplier of pharmaceuticals and health products worldwide. Apply now as D&L Intern Data Analyst.

Our Company is an innovative, global healthcare leader that is committed to improving health and well-being around the world. Our product offering categories include oncology products, vaccines, infectious diseases and animal health. We continue to focus our research on conditions that affect millions of people around the world while expanding our strengths in areas like vaccines and biologics. We also devote extensive time and energy to increasing access to medicines and vaccines through far-reaching programs that donate and deliver our products to the people who need them.

Our Supply Chain team ensures inventory is consistently available to meet customer demand. We coordinate all aspects of supply through supply planning, sourcing, making, inventory management, packaging and delivery. We partner across the Marketing, Finance and Manufacturing organizations to build a robust demand and supply plan and ensure we get products to the right customer, at the place, at the right time.

Job Scope

The person is expected to support the distribution & logistics team in data gathering, analytics and audit. This will involve interaction within the Supply Chain Management (SCM) team and liaison with external providers.

Main Responsibilities
  • Create standard templates for data collection
  • Work with external partners to collect and organize data
  • Benchmark freight forwarders performance
  • Audit freight forwarders documentation
  • Assist in monthly Distribution and Logistics spend analysis
  • Generate reports for management review
  • Support D&L project implementation and data analysis
Qualification:
  • Minimum Diploma or equivalent
  • Proficient with complex data analysis using MS-Excel
Experience:
  • Knowledge in Air & Ocean Freight forwarding will have an added advantage
Other Competencies and Personal Attributes*:
  • Proficient with desktop tools for communication and analysis (MS Excel, PowerPoint and Word)
  • Responsible and meticulous
  • Good communication and inter-personal skills.
Who we are

Merck & Co., Inc., Kenilworth, New Jersey, USA is known as Merck in the United States, Canada & Puerto Rico. We are known as MSD in Europe, Middle East, Africa, Latin America & Asia Pacific. We are a global biopharmaceutical leader with a diverse portfolio of prescription medicines, oncology, vaccines and animal health products.

We are driven by our purpose to develop and deliver innovative products that save and improve lives. With 69,000 employees operating in more than 140 countries, we offer state of the art laboratories, plants and offices that are designed to Inspire our employees as we learn, develop and grow in our careers. We are proud of our 125 years of service to humanity and continue to be one of the worlds biggest investors in Research & Development.

What we look for

In a world of rapid innovation, we seek brave Inventors who want to make an Impact in all aspects of our business, enabling breakthroughs that will affect generations to come. We encourage you to bring your disruptive thinking, collaborative spirit and diverse perspective to our organization. Together we will continue Inventing For Life, Impacting Lives while Inspiring Your Career Growth.

INVENT.

IMPACT.

INSPIRE.

We are proud to be a company that embraces the value of bringing diverse, talented, and committed people together. The fastest way to breakthrough innovation is when diverse ideas come together in an inclusive environment. We encourage our colleagues to respectfully challenge one anothers thinking and approach problems collectively for the common good. We are an equal opportunity employer, committed to fostering an inclusive and diverse workplace.

An economic empowerment engine, Airbnb has helped millions of hospitality entrepreneurs monetize their spaces and their passions while keeping the financial benefits of tourism in their own communities. With more than half a billion guest arrivals to date, and accessible in 62 languages across 191 countries and regions, Airbnb promotes people-to-people connection, community and trust around the world.

Trust is the foundation of our global community, and we want the interactions between our hosts and guests to embody our community values. But no global movement springs from any one individual - it takes an entire team united behind something big.

As an Operations Analyst, you will be responsible for building operational data visualizations, reporting on and performing statistical analysis to provide insights and recommendations.You will be working closely with the Senior Operations Analyst, your Specialization managers, Data Science, Risk Product and other stakeholders to provide feedback and improve our models and user experience that directly impact operational health.

title: Data Analyst
job_description:
At least 5 years of proven data analytics experience
Your new company
A leading technology-driven company

Your new role
Sitting in a Data COE, you will be responsible for supporting business stakeholders in end-to-end data analytics to generate actionable insights and data solutions for the business’s needs.
Be involved in end-to-end data analytics from data preparation and cleansing to analysis and presentation of insights to the business
Lead deep dive analyses, segmentation and slicing and dicing of data to generate actionable insights
Produce reports & maintain KPI dashboards to monitor the performance with cross-functional partners to uncover and explain drivers of performance.
Support cross-functional teams within the business to identify the white spaces and propose actionable items to support decision-making
Suggest metrics, analyze data and data profiling

What you’ll need to succeed
The ideal candidate will come with proven years of experience conducting end-to-end data analysis and working closely with various stakeholders within the business to generate insights leveraging advanced data analytics and identifying white spaces for the business. Experience mentoring or leading a team is a plus.
Proven hands-on experience using advanced analytics on large datasets (Python, R, SQL, Tableau)
Ability to effectively present analysis, key insights, facts & figures regardless of the audience
Critical thinking with a strong sense of urgency to resolve issues and with a meticulous attention to detail, ability to multi-task and prioritize to meet deadlines
Strategic thinker with demonstrated ability to envision the future state of the business and synthesize facts and insights into concrete, actionable strategies and plans
Stakeholder Management in a fast-paced matrix organization preferred

What you need to do now
If you’re interested in this role, click ‘apply now’ to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV. If this job isn’t quite right for you but you are looking for a new position within Data Science and Analytics, please contact Germaine Yin at +65 63030158 or email germaine.yin@hays.com.sg for a confidential discussion of your career! Hays Registration Number: 200609504D, EA License: 07C3924, Registration ID Number: R1982882
er: R1982882 #1151605

title: Business Analyst, Finance / Data (Director)
job_description:
Bank of Singapore opens doors to new opportunities.

Start your career with Bank of Singapore as a Business Analyst in our Bankwide Data, Risk & Reporting Team of Operations and Technology (O&T) Department!

At Bank of Singapore, we are constantly on the lookout for exceptional individuals to join our team. We promote a culture of openness, teamwork and fairness. Most importantly, we invest in our people through our programmes that develop them on both professional and personal levels. Besides attractive remuneration packages, we offer non-financial benefits and opportunities to develop your potential within OCBC Group’s global network of subsidiaries and offices. If you have passion, drive and the will to succeed, rise to the challenge today!

Responsibilities:
Project upgrade within BA Solutioning Lead responsibility (30")
  • As part of the Technology Change the Bank (CTB) vertical, need to manage & coordinate projects pertaining to Reporting, reconciliation and Data. Candidate should have Techno-Functional background to bridge between Business and Development team.
  • Help prioritize business requirements together with the business lead(s) vis-à-vis project constraints on time and budget (i.e. prioritizing important/high impact requirements for inclusion in the release scope in alignment to the timebox and moneybox of the project).
  • Articulate the business requirements to the vendor; provide effort estimation with 100" coverage of the business requirement relevant to vendor delivery.
  • Work with the SIT and UAT Test Managers/Leads to provide input to, review and approve the overall Test Strategy/Plan
  • Work with the testing teams to build, review and approve Test Cases – ensuring alignment to the FSD as well as all necessary Release Regression (RRT) tests
  • Carrying out application enhancement, support and cloud (private & public) base project implementation.
Core Finance ERP Systems (GL, FA, AP, Expenses, etc.) CTB implementation (30")
  • Preferred prior experience in the Core Finance CTB processes such as GST Reversed, ACU - DBU consolidation, Financial Regulatory Reporting (FRR), MAS 610, Account Dormancy, etc.
  • Maintain a working knowledge of business processes and solution design. Perform fit-gap analysis where known business requirements are not met.
  • Provide business analysis and business-related issue resolution to all cross-functional teams throughout the product development lifecycle.
Data Governance & Control (40&)
  • Experience in the Data dictionary definition, Data sourcing to the data lake, Data analytics, Data management tool and Enterprise Level Machine Learning Solution.
  • Participate in the roadmap for the bank’s operational data platform.
  • You will be working in IT team providing development and support for data integration, ETL and reporting applications.
  • Assist in coordinating prioritization of business requirements throughout the solution development lifecycle.
  • Must have project upgrade experience with vendors. Preferred experience with Intellimatch, TLM, Laservault, QlikView project upgrade experience.
  • Previous experience working on projects like Financial regulatory reporting e.g. MAS610, MAS 637, etc.
  • Experience in private banking Finance domain
  • Excellent communication skills, able to handle multiple projects and priorities concurrently and manage business expectations accordingly.
  • Strong skills in physical data model design, stored procedures, functions, indexes, performance tuning and understanding execution plans.
  • Strong experience in the field of Data management, Data Warehousing and ETL
  • Experience in writing use cases, use case modelling, workflows, business processes, business requirements document, functional specifications document and user requirements to the functional design traceability matrix
  • Good understanding of data and information structures in an IT system environment including that of data modelling and database design appreciation and SQL.
  • Experience in the discipline of System development life cycle (SDLC) process, especially in the solutioning, analysis, testing and implementation phases of the SDLC processes.
  • Knowledge of Finance COA, GL, P&L
  • Knowledge on various asset classes such as equities, fixed income, loans, deposits, FX, Options
  • Previous experience with platforms such as TEMENOS T24 or Triple A will be considered an advantage.
  • Prior experience with Senior stakeholder engagement and Software Vendor management would be preferred.

title: Data Visualization Analyst
job_description:
An excellent opportunity for a Business Intelligence Analyst to be a part of Business Analytics team within the Consumer Banking Group in a established Bank.

Mandatory Skill(s)

Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or Information System;
Hand on experience in designing and developing data visuals;

Exposure and understanding of ETL;
Experienced using business intelligent (BI) tools for developing applications as a part of data analytics and modelling activities;
Excellent written / oral communication skills to clearly articulate messages to a variety of stakeholders;
Proactive team player, working collaboratively with and through others.

Desirable Skill(s)

Prior experience in Banking domain;
Experience with SAS, Teradata.
Responsibilities

Engage stakeholders to develop functional data visualizations or dashboards;
Analyse various sources of data, design data models and visualize for Consumer Banking Group and Wealth Management;
Transform, improve and integrate data based on requirements provided by stakeholders;
Conducting assessment and examination of data from the source to ensure consistency;
Develop reports, dashboards and visualizations using multiple data sources in Power BI, Tableau or Qlikview;
Come up with ideas, experimenting, forming hypotheses and testing them out;
Validate accuracy of logic with clear test scenarios and back testing;
Ensure documentation and traceability of requirements and, process flow diagrams, and other project documents.

title: Senior / Data Analyst
job_description:
Job Description

Successful candidates will be working with massive amounts of data to develop Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence (AI) models with Telco and other sets of data to help enterprises realise key business value through the use of Telco Insights.

The senior data scientist will work closely key internal and external stakeholders to develop new AI products or new application areas for AI. The senior data scientist would enjoy developing AI applications for both internal and external stakeholders.

Responsibilities
  • Design and develop next generation of scalable Telco Big Data Analytics Models to support commercial projects across various business verticals.
  • Propose and design effective analytical approaches taking into consideration performance and scalability to large datasets, adhering to best practices for model development, and perform unit and system testing to validate the results of the analytics models. Constantly review and ensure that current methodology conforms and meets industry standards.
  • Participate and contribute to stakeholders’ requirement gatherings sessions, co-creation workshops to size up stakeholders’ problem statements and formulate and review best approaches to analytic solutions and models.
  • Propose and develop new analytics models and innovative techniques/algorithms to enhance SmartHub capabilities and value proposition of Telco Big Data.
  • Work with industry collaborators or research institutes for technical collaboration including proposing new potential areas for collaboration.
Qualifications
  • Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Information Systems, Computer Science, Analytics or related disciplines, along with at least 4 years of relevant experience in Big Data analytics modelling development. Experience in Telco industry will be an advantage.
  • At least 4 years of experience with Big Data Technologies
  • Creative problem solver and ability to think out of the box.
  • Experience in the following technologies: Hadoop, Kafka, Spark, PySpark.
  • Programming experience in one or more of the following languages: Java, JavaScript, Python.
  • Experience in NoSQL databases.
  • Exposure to real-time streaming technologies (e.g. Spark Streaming).
  • At least 4 years of experience with Machine Learning / AI
  • Able to apply algorithms such as GBM, Neural Networks, Naive Bayes, SVM, for problem solving.
  • Experience with MI/AL libraries and Deep Learning frameworks such as Tensorflow, SparkML, Keras
  • Attention to details, a self-starter and self-learner continuously keeping up to date with industry developments.
  • Team player and good people engagement skills.
*We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

title: Data Analyst
job_description:
At Lalamove, we believe in the power of community. Millions of drivers and customers use our technology every day to connect with one another and move things that matter. Delivery is what we do best and we ensure it is always fast and simple. Since 2013, we have tackled the logistics industry
head on to find the most innovative solutions for the world’s delivery needs.
We are full steam ahead to make Lalamove synonymous with delivery and on a mission to impact as many local communities we can. We have massively scaled our efforts across Asia and now have our sights on taking our best in-class technology to the rest of the world. And we need your help to get us
there!
Currently, we are building a strong in-house Regional marketing team here in Hong Kong & looking for a strong data analyst with a passion for Marketing to further strengthen our Growth Analytics team within our Growth Marketing organization. You will be responsible for carrying out analysis of internal CRM
data, analysing customer surveys & building reporting workflows to drive insights for our growth leaders as well as to our marketing managers to support decision making and further profitable growth.
What you'll do
The Day-to-day activities Understand and measure all stages of customer and driver acquisition funnel from awareness to purchase
Integrate, cleanse, migrate and manage data. Help develop the creation, flow and analysis of key data
Uncover actionable insights about our business through complex data analysis and communicate those insights effectively to functional leaders
Automate and maintain weekly, monthly and quarterly performance report to provide key learning and feedback (trends, patterns, irregularity) for the Regional Country Operations Team
Develop, execute, and report on growth experiments to provide insights to conversion rate optimization
What you'll need
3+ years professional experience in a quantitative field at a mobile or consumer web company
BA/BS in Business, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering or similar is preferable
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to draw inferences from abstract data patterns
Familiarity with data visualisation application (Tableau and/or other Business Intelligence tools)
Experience working with relational databases and SQL, Python.
Experience with developing, implementing, and reporting on AB tests.
Good understanding of key marketing metrics such as CAC and LTV
Desire to work in a fast-paced environment and to drive decisions with data
Excellent written and communication skills

title: Data Analyst
job_description:
Role/Responsibilities:
We are passionate about data. We collaborate to build elegant, effective, scalable and highly reliable solutions to empower predictive modelling in finance.

Our data services group is looking for a Data Analyst to join our dedicated team. Our group is responsible for the timely delivery of comprehensive and error-free data to some of the most demanding and successful systematic Portfolio Managers in the world.

This exceptional individual will be a member of a small team of Data Scientists/Analysts who play a vital role in ensuring the smooth day-to-day implementation of a large research infrastructure, and the live production trading of billions of dollars of capital across global capital markets, including equities, futures, options and other financial instruments.

Responsibilities include:
Identifying potential data sources
Coordinate with compliance team and legal team on new vendor trial/subscription process
Assist with collecting and maintaining overviews and vendor content offering
Assist with data questions and requests from investment teams
Setting up feed download and monitor check in database
Monitoring the automated data collection and cleansing infrastructure
Coordinating meetings and conference calls between data users and experts.
Assist in organizing presentations
Handle user requests and answer questions about data
Download trial datasets from vendor FTP sites or other delivery mechanism
Assist Data Team with manual data processing as required
Maintain Cubist Data Wiki contents

Requirements:
Master’s degree required
Basic level programming experience in R, Matlab, Python, SQL, Java or another language
Financial industry experience preferred but not required
Strong organization, communication and interpersonal skills
Attention to detail and a love of process
Strong oral and written communication skills
Ability to exercise sound judgment in assessing and determining how to handle queries, calls and issues

Ability to multitask and prioritize assignments

title: Data Analyst (Asst/ Manager)
job_description:

The ideal candidate must have a strong interest in developing data analytics solutions to address business problems as well as performing coding to analyse complex datasets and developing models that optimize business outcome. The right candidate needs to be comfortable with engaging a wide range of stakeholders and is able to interact effectively with both the technology teams and the business units.

  • Develop processes and tools to monitor and analyse model performance and data accuracy

  • Keep in pace with the latest data management, analytical tools and methodology

  • Proven track record of applying Machine Learning in real-world industrial settings to make decisions, uncover data patterns/trends and predict outcomes
  • Familiar with IoT Architecture
  • Passion for learning new techniques and solving challenging problems
  • Ability to work independently and in cross-functional teams to drive business solutions
  • Good analytical and presentation skills, including the ability to articulate complex data analysis in both technical and non-technical approach to stakeholders

title: Data Analyst with an Agency to handle a huge Global Consumer Tech Brand
job_description:
Are you ready to go big across Southeast Asia and the Pacific region?
Are you nitty-gritty about data analytics, all marketing efforts must be supported by data?
Do you deeply believe that data is the key factor that should drive execution, engagement and conversion?
In order to drive sales and personalized communication, everything must first come from data analytics?
Then this might be the right role for you!

Company: Bringing ideas to life. Limitless.
This advertising agency is a publicly listed company and has been around for over 4 decades with business partners, and we say business partners because that’s how they manage to forge great relationships with their clients, for long years too by looking after others like they do for their own. Delivering successful marketing campaigns either or/and combining online offline, ATL and BTL channels.

With Singapore office being their hub for their Southeast Asia and Pacific Region, the company currently has a team of over 50 making sure that the brands they manage are able to grow in revenue through their marketing and communication efforts.

Getting people to move, seamlessly.
If it does not lead to action, impactful engagement, then it is simply ineffective. This agency has the right approach to delivering communications and marketing solutions by creating multi-variate strategies, creative solutions, integrated marketing and communications, providing the right digital experience that best represents the brand and what it is about.

They are a silent name behind big players. They combine a professional approach to getting things done. Do what you do best, create strategies and be a part of a collaborative team who instils discipline to see through goals. This family is decisive, a go-getter and resembles a spirit of success and great relationships in everything they do. All these things are not easy but they provide strong leadership to put together a venue and environment for dreams to come to life, and you have got to work for it.

They are only as serious as you are. Does it sound like a place for you? It’s not for everyone. Otherwise, everybody is on top. But you will be an even better professional and you will take pride of your work, and your colleagues and partners. That’s the type of family they have, they support each other to keep growing.

The Role; Data Analyst for a massive Global Consumer Tech Brand SEAPAC region:
Creation of Consumer Data-driven Marketing monthly report
KPI framing including sub KPI(Execution/Engagement/Conversion) in addition to main KPI (Sales contribution)
CRM campaign in-depth analysis (Campaign level personalization & creative analysis)
Report aggregation based on the different report from (CRM/Dotcom/Media)
Data partnership project audience insight analytics (Playbook / Campaign scenario)
Market research level of business land scape (Partner’s audience data size)
Audience data collaboration insight based on each partner’s data points
Brand’s target audience identification based on different data source (CRM/Dotcom/Media)
Campaign scenario framing based on audience segmentation

As a Data Analytst, your role might potentially cover:
CDM Dashboard
Automated process of CDM report (Report process automation by using Datorama)
In-depth campaign insight report for marketer’s decision making (Report framing for campaign insight)
Data partnership campaign performance report
KPI framing for performance tracking
In-depth campaign analysis for Data partnership campaign)

Job Requirements:
Data processing – identify the right number along the different data source by using the right tool
CRM data analytics
Aggregated level of report analytics by using CRM reporting tool (SAP Hybris)
Audience profiling & segmentation based on the CRM data variables
In-depth analytics based on SQL query on raw data access (more advanced level than Dotcom data analytics dashboard reporting)
Media data analytics
Media campaign performance analysis based on performance(CTR/Conversion) & ROI(CPC/CPM/CPA) points by using media analytics tools like Adwords / Facebook Ads / Doubleclick
Audience insight based on Media planning tools like Google keyword/Display planner & Facebook audience insight
Media data analytics
Media campaign performance analysis based on performance(CTR/Conversion) & ROI(CPC/CPM/CPA) points by using media analytics tools like Adwords / Facebook Ads / Doubleclick
Audience insight based on Media planning tools like Google keyword/Display planner & Facebook audience insight

Qualifications:
Essential

6year of data analytics experience
2year of Adobe analytics or Google analytics
2year of SQL based analytics experience
2year of Dashboard tools running like Dataroma, clicksense, etc.
2year of Basic coding skills to automate the data processing like Python
Good to have

Media data analytics like Adwords, Facebook Ads, DoubleClick
Competitor analytics like Similarweb, Alexarank, Appannie
FB/GG audience insight tools (Google keyword planner, Display planner, FB audience insight)
CRM data analytics like SalesForce, SAP Hybris

What they offer:
Salary up to SGD 6,000 per month
Mobile reimbursements of up to SGD 150 depending on job grade
Insurance an Group Hospitalization and Surgical Insurance
Increase in variation to be discussed during the hiring process
Biggest perk is to see your data and strategies come to life, experience growth internally and of your partners

For more vacancies, visit: https://www.finestpeople.com.sg/jobs/

title: Data Analyst
job_description:
Data Analyst, Group Customer Analytics & Decisioning

About OCBC
Having purpose and making a real impact drives what we do at OCBC, for our customers, colleagues and the community. People count on us to deliver an amazing banking experience, but more importantly one that is uncomplicated and complements their changing lifestyle and business needs. Our employees are the architects that make this all possible; they are high performing individuals and teams, experts in their field and above all believe in our purpose and commitment to customers.
Our community of game changers at OCBC builds for the future; think Ambitious goals, act with a strong Belief and execute with Courage and agility to drive impact. These ABCs sit at the centre of our culture of change and innovation.

What you’ll do
  • Working within the Group Customer Analytics & Decisioning team, you will design data driven solutions to enable the Consumer Bank to capture new business opportunities.
  • Regular interaction with product and channel managers to understand their business objectives. Proactively recommend on how you think data & analytics could help them achieve their goals.
  • Apply data discovery, segmentation & other exploration techniques to identify emerging trends and opportunities for refining OCBC’s customer propositions.
  • Develop targeting marketing campaigns to drive relevant communications to OCBC’s customers & front-line channels – including design of Post-Campaign Analysis solutions to track effectiveness and uplift of Marketing activity.
  • Design of data visualisation and interactive dashboards.
  • Some use of more advanced analytical modelling techniques to predict & optimise customer and portfolio outcomes.
  • LI-EN
Qualifications

What you’ll bring:
  • Minimum 2 years hands-on experience working in an analytical marketing team – actively using Campaign Management software and/or dashboard design, model building. Banking industry experience not necessary.
  • Strong experience in Campaign Management function – with hands-on experience of a leading tool from the likes of Unica, Adobe, SAS. Awareness of Direct Marketing concepts such as A:B Testing, Event Based Marketing.
  • Strong hands-on skills in analytical tools like EDW, SQL, Qlik/Tableau, SAS, Python.
Knowledge of modern infrastructure/ tools like Hadoop, Talend, Spark is a plus.
  • Excellent communication skills with the ability to articulate complex solutions to non-technical users.
  • Energetic personality with an innovative, self-starting spirit. Someone that likes to ask “why?”

Organization: Group Customer Analytics and Decisioning
Schedule: Permanent
: Full-time

title: Data Analyst
job_description:
N3 is Hiring for Data Analysts in Singapore!

Do you…
  • Want to work in Technology with some of the hottest household brand-names on the planet?
  • Desire to develop a life-long career in the growing software, IT and technology hardware market?
If so…

This is a fantastic opportunity to start or continue your career in cutting edge cloud technologies & professional services sales.

N3 is a sales and marketing solutions firm dedicated to working with software and technology solutions providers. Our client base includes a range from small start-up companies to market leaders such as Cisco, Microsoft, IBM, Citrix, and more as well as their partner networks. N3 has sustained rapid growth since its founding in 2004 and is currently undergoing exponential growth with numerous multinational, multibillion-dollar companies.

At N3, we are a performance-based organization that rewards creativity, hard work, and success. N3 is not your typical corporate environment. Our business casual atmosphere and fast-paced workday make N3 a unique place to work.

Data Analyst



Responsibilities:

•Managing master data, including creation, updates, and deletion.

•Provide quality assurance of imported data, working with quality assurance analyst if necessary.

•Commissioning and decommissioning of data sets.

•Processing confidential data and information according to guidelines.

•Helping develop reports and analysis.

•Managing and designing the reporting environment, including data sources, security, and metadata.

•Supporting the data warehouse in identifying and revising reporting requirements.

•Supporting initiatives for data integrity and normalization.

•Assessing tests and implementing new or upgraded software and assisting with strategic decisions on new systems.

•Generating reports from single or multiple systems.

•Troubleshooting the reporting database environment and reports.

•Evaluating changes and updates to source production systems.

•Training end users on new reports and dashboards.

•Providing technical expertise on data storage structures, data mining, and data cleansing.

Requirements

•Must be Singapore Citizen or PR

•1-2 years’ experience in data & analytics or similar internship experience

•Some degree of understanding of web analytics tools such as Adobe Analytics, DTM, Google Analytics, Power BI or GTM

•Strong grasp of JS, HTML and CSS

•Proficient in database concepts especially SQL and MongoDB, and Experience in using data visualisation tools such as DOMO, Tableau etc.

•Exposure to marketing data, tools and platform is a bonus

•Any working knowledge of CRM or marketing automation platforms such as Salesforce, Eloqua, Marketo or Microsoft dynamics would be highly desirable

•Knowledge in scripting languages in scripting languages such as Python and R

•Work with internal management and team members to understand and clarify visualization requirements / needs

•Use advanced data visualization tools to provide an easy to understand interface for end users to quickly identify key themes within their data

•Identify key business metrics measurements and develop methods to represent data in support of the measurements

•Create strong blending data capabilities within team so that we can come up with useful client information from data very quickly

•Engage with business stakeholders’ cross countries and gather requirement and liaise with ETL team to get the required data preparation.

•Provide guidance and insight on data visualization and dashboard design best practices

•Build dashboards, automated reports and report templates

•Analyse, troubleshoot and tune product performance or deployment issues when required

•Perform data validation and dashboard performance optimization

•Engage with business stakeholders’ cross countries and gather requirement and liaise with ETL team to get the required data preparation

•Experience using SQL to build custom datasets for reporting or analysis

•Experience in data modelling

•Work within the Business Innovations department to identify data related problems and provide solutions

•Process data to develop reports specifically required by the department

•Analyse information using various statistical methods, trying to see patterns in data

•Create reports and presentations

•Minimum Diploma/ Degree in Statistics/Computer Science

•High proficiency in Microsoft Excel is required

•Good communication skill and interpersonal skill

Employees have grown within N3 into leadership roles to include President, VPs, Strategic Directors, Program Managers, Inside Sales Team Managers, Team Leads, Project Managers and Peer Mentors.

Equal Employment Opportunity

N3 recruits, hires, and promotes for all positions without regard to gender, marital status, family status, age, race, religion, disability, sexual orientation, membership of the Traveler community.

All terms and conditions of employment such as compensation, benefits, work assignment, availability of facilities and privileges of employment are administered on the same basis of equality.

title: Data Analyst
job_description:
About Cubist
Cubist Systematic Strategies is one of the world’s premier investment firms. The firm deploys systematic, computer-driven trading strategies across multiple liquid asset classes, including equities, futures and foreign exchange. The core of our effort is rigorous research into a wide range of market anomalies, fueled by our unparalleled access to a wide range of publicly available data sources.
Job Description
We are passionate about data. We collaborate to build elegant, effective, scalable and highly reliable solutions to empower predictive modelling in finance.
Cubist’s Data Services group is looking for a Data Analyst to join our dedicated team. Our group is responsible for the timely delivery of comprehensive and error-free data to some of the most demanding and successful systematic Portfolio Managers in the world.
This exceptional individual will be a member of a small team of Data Scientists/Analysts who play a vital role in ensuring the smooth day-to-day implementation of a large research infrastructure, and the live production trading of billions of dollars of capital across global capital markets, including equities, futures, options and other financial instruments.

  • Assisting Data team with interoffice travel arrangements, expenses, etc.
  • Assisting in organizing presentations

  • Downloading trial datasets from vendor FTP sites or other delivery mechanism
  • Assisting Data Team with manual data processing as required
  • Maintaining Cubist Data Wiki contents
    • Desirable Candidates
  • Bachelor degree required
  • Basic understanding of SQL.
  • Programming skills in Python and at least one of C#, C++, or Java are a plus
  • Proficient knowledge of Microsoft Outlook, Excel, and Word
  • Financial industry experience is preferred but not required
  • Strong organization, communication and interpersonal skills

  • Ability to multitask and prioritize assignments

title: Data Analyst
job_description:
About The Company


Creadits has reinvented digital advertising.


The world's largest advertisers are already on our platform:

  • World's largest ride-hailing apps
  • World's largest e-commerce marketplaces
  • World's largest gaming companies
  • World's leading apparel companies


A single global marketplace for advertising talent, using a unified currency - Creadits.


Creadits are used globally to acquire anything required to start advertising - graphic design, video shoots, writing, campaign management, training, even data.


The Creadits platform will provide a global view of talents and opportunities to get involved in projects.


A global talent pool can set values for Creadits, trading transparently.


Global talent will no longer be trapped by borders or exchange rates. Creadits unlocks and unifies advertising, across any platform, and any geography.


More than facilitating transactions, the Creadits platform can make creative and strategic recommendations, improving and predicting campaign outcomes.


Are you someone who can solve challenging problems? You dont just know how to code, more importantly, you know how to tackle problems innovatively. Programming language is merely a tool for you, making an impact is your real goal.


Creadits uses data-driven and AI-centric approaches to disrupt the way advertising used to be done. We are not an advertising agency. Instead, we help advertisers remove their reliance on agencies and achieve greater performance while spending less time on managing campaigns.


We are a team of people with diverse skill sets including deep learning, software engineering, computer vision, DevOps, statistics, and data engineering, and analytics. With core R&D of the company being the team's main responsibility, we do not limit your job scope, or, your potential. The only limit you may have is yourself.


Roles & Responsibilities

  • Work with product team in collecting requirements, create data pipelines. Focusing on improving the product features and providing insights to stakeholders.
  • Identify, collect, analyze, and interpret new data sets based on business requirements and generate descriptive visualizations and presentations to communicate insights, as needed.
  • Research new algorithms and machine learning solutions for solving business problems and improving the user experience.
  • Locate and define new process improvement opportunities.




Requirements:

Skills & Experience

  • Masters/Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Statistics, or other quantitative or related technical fields.
  • 2-5+ years of relevant experience in data analytics, data science or applied statistics.
  • Experience with machine learning, data mining, statistical modeling tools and underlying algorithms.
  • Strong experience in R, Python, and/or other languages for large scale analysis of data.
  • Strong knowledge of relational databases and SQL.
  • Experience with data visualization tools like Data Studio, Tableau, etc.


Nice to have

  • Experience in RESTful API design and implementation (Preferably in Python)
  • Knowledge of various machine learning libraries like Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, MLib etc. is a good plus.

Why work with us?

  • Build customer-facing technology products for global customers.
  • Chance to work with an international team of smart engineers.
  • Company-sponsored happy hours.


** Please upload your resume along with your application.

title: Data Analyst
job_description:
Viki is a premier global entertainment streaming site where millions of people discover and consume primetime shows and movies subtitled in more than 200 languages, by our community of fans. With billions of videos viewed and more than 1 billion words translated, Viki brings global entertainment to fans everywhere! We are also part of the Rakuten Group of companies, which includes Viber, eBates, Lyft and more, reaching a global audience of nearly 1 billion users.

Soompi, also part of Rakuten Viki, is one of the biggest global K-pop news sites and the longest-running fandom community. From innovative engagement features to original content and social shopping, Rakuten Viki and Soompi are pushing the boundaries of user engagement and social viewing.

At Rakuten Viki, our engineering teams utilize leading-edge technologies to build a world class product. You will join a diverse and talented team with great ambitions to change the digital entertainment landscape. We are looking for top talent across APAC to join our Growth Analytics team as a Data Analyst. If you are inspired to take up new challenges then come be a part of our Rakuten Viki team in Singapore.

Viki is seeking a smart and hard-working Data Analyst for our Product and Growth Analytics Team. At Viki, we handle terabytes of data to help us understand our users and learn about content trends. Our analytics team is first and foremost responsible for collecting, processing and organizing these large amounts of data using advanced and scalable techniques. They then analyze these complex datasets to generate deeper insights and help various teams at Viki effectively utilize it for crucial decision making.

Responsibilities:
  • Create useful reports and dashboards to help generate insights for Product and Growth teams.
  • Help structure and analyze A/B tests and data from experiments
  • Validate events data and work with engineers to ensure that data collection has been correctly implemented
  • Conduct inferential analysis and predictive analysis to model user behavior and relevant metrics
  • Analyze content consumption data to help content and marketing teams strategize
  • Deep dive into big data and provide business intelligence and analytics support to key company-wide business initiatives
Qualifications:
  • BS in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics or a related discipline with 2-4 years of relevant work experience
  • Outstanding quantitative and analytical skills
  • Highly proficient in writing complex SQL queries
  • Deep understanding of the usage and interpretation of statistical methods
  • Interest in large scale data mining, gathering insights and reporting
  • Prior experience with the following languages/tools is highly preferred:
  • For data modeling: R, Python
  • For data processing: Hadoop, MapReduce, Kafka, BigQuery, Spark
  • For data visualization: Tableau, Qlikview, Looker, Holistics
We’re small but diverse, with more than 25 nationalities and 40 languages represented among our 100+ employees. Come break down barriers that stand between great entertainment and its fans everywhere and help us make a difference as we grow.

title: Data Analyst
job_description:
The Government Digital Services (GDS) Team aims to spearhead the digital transformation of government. Our team aims to design and develop software applications that help government agencies to better serve the needs of the people of Singapore.

We are looking for a Data Analyst who is passionate in using data to contribute to production grade products, which will result in the streamlining of the customer service journey delivery process, thereby benefiting the public. You will be scoping the project with stakeholders, using data sets currently available in the team or across Government Agencies to build useful data products which will be consumed by the masses.
What to Expect:
  • Collaborate with stakeholders to understand their needs/pain points
  • Design solutions to be used for streamlining operations and/or develop solutions for citizens
  • Build and manage the entire end-to-end lifecycle, including:
    • Scoping data inputs
    • Data cleaning and pre-processing
    • Feature engineering
    • Building models
    • Deploying to production
    • Improving models by iterations
  • Contribute to the data architecture engineering decisions to support analytics
  • Analyse Website and Mobile Application data and suggest actionable insights for improvements

How to Succeed:

  • Experience in analysing Web and Mobile Application data
  • Experience with cloud deployments using AWS is an added advantage
  • Good communication skills to articulate findings and recommendations
  • Passionate to know more about predictive modelling algorithms/recommender systems

title: Data Quality Analyst
job_description:
Our Financial Information business in Singapore is seeking a Data Quality Analyst reporting to the Head of Data Operations APAC. The role is based in Singapore. The role is responsible for supporting and executing all the data quality improvement initiatives for the Asia Pacific region. The role sits within the wider Data Operations team in APAC contributing to the publishing of accurate, consistent and timely financial data which SIX is known for around the world.
  • To manage and support the data quality improvement activities and initiatives for all APAC markets.
  • Conduct daily quality checks and audits to measure the quality (accuracy, timeliness and completeness) of both reference and market data.
  • Report, analyze and present results of audits, checks and evaluations.
  • Identify and escalate areas for improvement to data quality issues.
  • Undertake root cause analysis on complex client data issues to identify main issue and solutions.
  • Leading team discussions related to Global Data Rules (GDRs) and Market Guides (MG) as well as accessing the impact of these on the APAC markets.
  • Review APAC specific working procedures and input processes according to GDRs and local MGs, identifying knowledge gaps and providing comprehensive training to Data Production staff within APAC.
  • Active involvement and contribution in global monthly quality calls, global data quality dashboard findings, virtual team discussions, APAC data quality audits, third party data supplier quality reviews and data quality clean-ups.
  • Collaboration with various functional areas namely:
    (a) Business Analysis on the impact of new content and feed changes on data quality,
    (b) Customer Support on client related complex data quality issues and
    (c) Marketing Products & Partners on the roll-out of new APAC content
The sucessful candidate will have excellent verbal and written business communications skills and hold an undergraduate degree in any discipline. He or she will be of an analytical and conceptual mind and have a broad knowledge of a range of asset classes as well as an understanding of the value chain of financial information. Previous experience and track record as a data trouble shooter or as an experienced data analyst is desirable.

He or she will be fluent in handling multiple tasks in parallel whilst retaining an overall view of the process (value chain), possess an excellent end-to-end data flow knowledge and have the technical IT ability to understand internal databases and ITIL processes. Customer focussed, he or she will be a self starter who can work independently yet be equally comfortable working within a team. Fluency in Asian languages are an advantage.
